allSpells.name: Abi-Dalzim's Horrid Wilting
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of sponge)
allSpells.description: You draw the moisture from every creature in a 30-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. Constructs and undead aren't affected, and plants and water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage. A creature takes 12d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Nonmagical plants in the area that aren't creatures, such as trees and shrubs, wither and die instantly.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This spell resonates powerfully near the borders of the Blooming Rot, where moisture is often corrupted by fungal growth.

allSpells.name: Absolute Silence
allSpells.description:
You create a 30-foot radius sphere of complete silence at a point you can see. Within the sphere:

- No sound can be created or pass through

- Creatures are immune to thunder damage

- Verbal spellcasting is impossible

- Creatures inside are deafened

- Communication is limited to gestures and writing

Unlike the standard Silence spell, this silence is absolute - even telepathy feels muted within it.

**Sovereign Attention:** Azerach can hear everything that isn't being said in this silence.

allSpells.name: Absolute Stillness
allSpells.description:
You invoke the perfect silence of the Whispered King. A 120-foot radius sphere of absolute stillness centers on you. Within this sphere:

- All sound ceases to exist

- All air movement stops (flying creatures not magically sustained fall)

- Verbal spellcasting is impossible; even telepathy is muffled

- Creatures must hold their breath or begin suffocating

- Ranged projectile weapons have their range halved (no air to fly through)

- You can move normally and breathe within the stillness

**Sovereign Attention:** Azerach perceives everything within this stillness as if standing beside you.

allSpells.name: Acid Splash
allSpells.description: You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose one creature within range, or choose two creatures within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

allSpells.name: Aid
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a tiny strip of white cloth)
allSpells.description: Your spell bolsters your allies with toughness and resolve. Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target's hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 5 for the duration.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, a target's hit points increase by an additional 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Alarm
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a tiny bell and a piece of fine silver wire)
allSpells.description:
You set an alarm against unwanted intrusion. Choose a door, a window, or an area within range that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. Until the spell ends, an alarm alerts you whenever a Tiny or larger creature touches or enters the warded area. When you cast the spell, you can designate creatures that will not set off the alarm. You also choose whether the alarm is mental or audible.

A mental alarm alerts you with a ping in your mind if you are within 1 mile of the warded area. This ping awakens you if you are sleeping.

An audible alarm produces the sound of a hand bell for 10 seconds within 60 feet.

allSpells.name: Alter Self
allSpells.description:
You assume a different form. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following options, the effects of which last for the duration of the spell. While the spell lasts, you can end one option as an action to gain the benefits of a different one.

**Aquatic Adaptation.** You adapt your body to an aquatic environment, sprouting gills and growing webbing between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

**Change Appearance.** You transform your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change.

**Natural Weapons.** You grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and you are proficient with your unarmed strikes. Finally, the natural weapon is magic and you have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls you make using it.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Apotheosis
allSpells.components: V, S, M (the remains of your most honored ancestor, given willingly)
allSpells.description:
You merge with the collective wisdom and power of your entire ancestral line. For the duration:

- Your ability scores each increase by 4 (maximum 26)

- You gain proficiency in all skills, tools, and saving throws your ancestors possessed

- You can speak all languages any ancestor spoke

- You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma checks

- Once per round, when you would fail a saving throw or miss an attack, an ancestor intervenes - you can reroll with advantage

- You can cast any spell from your ancestors' collective knowledge of 5th level or lower without expending a spell slot (once each)

**Cost:** When the spell ends, you must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On failure, one ancestor's personality dominates your own for 24 hours - you retain your goals but act according to their mannerisms and values.

**Special:** If cast at the site of an ancestor's death or burial, the duration extends to 8 hours.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Army
allSpells.components: V, S, M (weapons or armor from fallen warriors worth at least 100 gp)
allSpells.description:
You summon the spirits of forgotten warriors. 4 spectral soldiers appear in unoccupied spaces within range. They use the statistics of Guards but are incorporeal (resistance to nonmagical damage, can move through creatures and objects).

The spirits fight as you direct and can understand any language you speak. They cannot speak, but salute fallen enemies.

When the spell ends, the spirits bow to you and fade, taking their equipment with them.
allSpells.higherLevels: You summon 2 additional spirits for each slot level above 4th.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Council
allSpells.components: V, S, M (offerings to the dead worth 500 gp)
allSpells.description:
You summon a council of ancestral spirits to advise you. The spirits (1d4+2 appear) can answer questions about history, provide tactical advice, share knowledge of skills or languages, or warn of dangers.

The spirits are not omniscient but have access to the collective knowledge of your ancestors. They can also serve as translators, having knowledge of ancient languages.

The spirits will not fight for you but may warn you of ambushes or treachery.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Fury
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a weapon used by an ancestor)
allSpells.description:
You channel the rage of fallen warriors. For the duration:

- You have advantage on melee attack rolls

- Your melee weapon attacks deal an additional 1d8 necrotic damage

- You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

- You cannot be frightened

When the spell ends, you gain one level of exhaustion.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Guardian
allSpells.components: V, S, M (an heirloom worth at least 100 gp)
allSpells.description:
You summon a spectral ancestor to protect you. The guardian occupies your space and has the following properties:

- When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to have the guardian take the hit instead (the guardian has 40 HP and resistance to all damage)

- The guardian can make opportunity attacks using your spell attack modifier (2d8 + spellcasting modifier necrotic damage)

- Hostile creatures within 10 feet have disadvantage on attack rolls against you

allSpells.name: Ancestral Guidance
allSpells.description:
You open a channel to ancestral memory that provides context rather than direct assistance. For the duration, when you encounter something an ancestor experienced - a location they visited, a language they spoke, a creature they fought - you receive fragmented impressions: emotional reactions, partial memories, instinctive warnings.

This grants advantage on History checks about things your ancestors witnessed, and the DM may provide cryptic hints about dangers or opportunities your bloodline has faced before. The impressions are often confusing or incomplete - ancestors don't explain, they simply remember.

Additionally, once during the duration, you can ask "Has my bloodline faced this before?" and receive a yes/no answer (if any ancestor within 10 generations encountered similar circumstances).

allSpells.name: Ancestral Judgment
allSpells.components: V, S, M (ashes of someone the target wronged)
allSpells.description:
You summon the spirits of those wronged by a creature to deliver judgment. The target must make a Charisma saving throw:

- On failure: 10d8 necrotic damage + 1d8 per creature they've killed in their lifetime (maximum +10d8)

- On success: Half damage

A creature that has never killed takes only 5d8 damage on a failed save.

The spirits manifest briefly around the target, whispering accusations. Creatures within 30 feet hear them and know what the target has done.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Legion
allSpells.components: V, S, M (weapons from fallen warriors worth 2,500 gp)
allSpells.description:
You summon an army of ancestral spirits. 10 spectral warriors appear (use Veteran statistics but with resistance to nonmagical damage and immunity to frightened). They obey your commands and fight as a coordinated unit.

When the spell ends, the spirits salute and fade.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Skill
allSpells.description:
You surrender control of your hands to an ancestor who mastered a specific craft. Choose a tool or instrument - an ancestor who was skilled with it temporarily possesses your hands, performing tasks with their expertise rather than yours.

For the duration, your hands move with unfamiliar precision. You have advantage on checks using the chosen tool, and you can attempt tasks that would normally require years of training (forge a blade, pick a complex lock, perform surgery) as if you had professional skill. However, you cannot use your hands for anything else - they're occupied.

The ancestor may have their own opinions about what you're making. Simple requests are fulfilled as expected, but complex or morally fraught tasks may be completed... differently than you intended.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Tongue
allSpells.description:
You speak in the voice of your ancestors - literally. For the duration, your voice carries the timbre, accent, and speech patterns of a specific ancestor you name (or a random one if you don't specify). Creatures who knew that ancestor recognize the voice immediately.

This grants advantage on Persuasion checks against descendants of people your ancestor knew, and on Intimidation checks against descendants of your ancestor's enemies. Old oaths sworn by your ancestor may be invoked through you, and doors sealed to "blood of the speaker" may recognize you.

However, old grudges also carry forward. Creatures with ancestral enmity toward your bloodline have advantage on saves against your spells for the duration.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Vengeance
allSpells.components: V, S, M (the weapon that killed an ancestor)
allSpells.description:
You summon the spirits of all who have been wronged to deliver vengeance. A creature you can see is surrounded by spectral accusers:

- The target has disadvantage on all attack rolls and saving throws

- At the start of each of their turns, they take 6d8 necrotic damage

- They cannot willingly move closer to any creature

- They can use their action to make a Charisma save to end the effect

allSpells.name: Ancestral Wisdom
allSpells.components: V, S, M (incense worth 250 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You don't ask questions - you become a vessel for ancestral experience. For the duration, you can invoke any skill, knowledge, or expertise that any of your ancestors possessed within the last 1,000 years.

**Invoke Ancestor:** As a bonus action, call upon a specific type of ancestor (warrior, scholar, thief, diplomat, etc.). Until you invoke another ancestor or the spell ends, you gain:

- Proficiency in two skills or tools that ancestor would have known

- Knowledge they possessed (languages, history, secrets they learned)

- Their personality traits bleeding into your behavior (a warrior ancestor makes you aggressive, a scholar makes you cautious)

**Ancestral Memory:** Once during the duration, you can ask "What would my ancestors have done?" regarding a specific situation. You receive a vivid memory of how an ancestor handled a similar circumstance - not advice, but precedent.

**Cost:** Frequent use of this spell causes ancestral bleed. If used more than once per day, make a DC 15 Wisdom save or adopt one personality trait from the last ancestor invoked for 24 hours.

allSpells.name: Ancestral Witness
allSpells.components: V, S, M (an heirloom or relic)
allSpells.description:
You call upon the dead to observe through your eyes. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

- You can see invisible creatures and objects

- You have advantage on Insight checks

- You can perceive when someone is lying (you sense it as a chill)

However, the dead are judging. If you commit an act that dishonors the memory of the fallen during this spell (cowardice, betrayal, oath-breaking), you take 2d6 psychic damage and the spell ends.

allSpells.name: Animal Friendship
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a morsel of food)
allSpells.description: This spell lets you convince a beast that you mean it no harm. Choose a beast that you can see within range. It must see and hear you. If the beast's Intelligence is 4 or higher, the spell fails. Otherwise, the beast must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the spell's duration. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the spell ends.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional beast for each slot level above 1st.
allSpells.ashenRealms: The morsel of food should be Spore Bread or preserved meat from the Ashen Realms.

allSpells.name: Animal Messenger
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a morsel of food)
allSpells.description:
By means of this spell, you use an animal to deliver a message. Choose a Tiny beast you can see within range, such as a squirrel, a blue jay, or a bat. You specify a location, which you must have visited, and a recipient who matches a general description, such as "a man or woman dressed in the uniform of the town guard" or "a red-haired dwarf wearing a pointed hat." You also speak a message of up to twenty-five words. The target beast travels for the duration of the spell toward the specified location, covering about 50 miles per 24 hours for a flying messenger, or 25 miles for other animals.

When the messenger arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, replicating the sound of your voice. The messenger speaks only to a creature matching the description you gave. If the messenger does not reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the beast makes its way back to where you cast this spell.
allSpells.higherLevels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration of the spell increases by 48 hours for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Animal Shapes
allSpells.description:
Your magic turns others into beasts. Choose any number of willing creatures that you can see within range. You transform each target into the form of a Large or smaller beast with a challenge rating of 4 or lower. On subsequent turns, you can use your action to transform affected creatures into new forms.

The transformation lasts for the duration for each target, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. You can choose a different form for each target. A target's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast, though the target retains its alignment and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. The target assumes the hit points of its new form, and when it reverts to its normal form, it returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The target can't activate, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, beasts transformed by this spell often take on characteristics of the local domain—rot-touched fur near the Blooming Rot, ashen coloring near Veinspire.

allSpells.name: Animate Dead
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust)
allSpells.description:
This spell creates an undead servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an undead creature. The target becomes a skeleton if you chose bones or a zombie if you chose a corpse.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you. You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you animate or reassert control over two additional undead creatures for each slot level above 3rd. Each of the creatures must come from a different corpse or pile of bones.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, the bone dust component can be substituted with powdered Corpse-Cap mushroom spores, which grow abundantly on decaying matter.

allSpells.name: Animate Objects
allSpells.description:
Objects come to life at your command. Choose up to ten nonmagical objects within range that are not being worn or carried. Medium targets count as two objects, Large targets count as four objects, Huge targets count as eight objects. You can't animate any object larger than Huge. Each target animates and becomes a creature under your control until the spell ends or until reduced to 0 hit points.

As a bonus action, you can mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 500 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

**Animated Object Statistics:**

| Size | HP | AC | Attack | Damage | Str | Dex |

|------|----|----|--------|--------|-----|-----|

| Tiny | 20 | 18 | +8 | 1d4 + 4 | 4 | 18 |

| Small | 25 | 16 | +6 | 1d8 + 2 | 6 | 14 |

| Medium | 40 | 13 | +5 | 2d6 + 1 | 10 | 12 |

| Large | 50 | 10 | +6 | 2d10 + 2 | 14 | 10 |

| Huge | 80 | 10 | +8 | 2d12 + 4 | 18 | 6 |

An animated object is a construct with AC, hit points, attacks, Strength, and Dexterity determined by its size. Its Constitution is 10 and its Intelligence and Wisdom are 3, and its Charisma is 1. Its speed is 30 feet; if the object lacks legs or other appendages it can use for locomotion, it instead has a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. It has blindsight with a radius of 30 feet and is blind beyond that distance.
allSpells.higherLevels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can animate two additional objects for each slot level above 5th.

allSpells.name: Antilife Shell
allSpells.description: A shimmering barrier extends out from you in a 10-foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you and hedging out creatures other than undead and constructs. The barrier lasts for the duration. The barrier prevents an affected creature from passing or reaching through. An affected creature can cast spells or make attacks with ranged or reach weapons through the barrier. If you move so that an affected creature is forced to pass through the barrier, the spell ends.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This spell is particularly favored by those who travel through the Blooming Rot, where living creatures often pose the greatest threat.

allSpells.name: Antimagic Field
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of powdered iron or iron filings)
allSpells.description:
A 10-foot-radius invisible sphere of antimagic surrounds you. This area is divorced from the magical energy that suffuses the multiverse. Within the sphere, spells can't be cast, summoned creatures disappear, and even magic items become mundane. Until the spell ends, the sphere moves with you, centered on you.

Spells and other magical effects, except those created by an artifact or a deity, are suppressed in the sphere and can't protrude into it. A slot expended to cast a suppressed spell is consumed. While an effect is suppressed, it doesn't function, but the time it spends suppressed counts against its duration.

**Targeted Effects.** Spells and other magical effects that target a creature or an object in the sphere have no effect on that target.

**Areas of Magic.** The area of another spell or magical effect can't extend into the sphere. If the sphere overlaps an area of magic, the part of the area that is covered by the sphere is suppressed.

**Spells.** Any active spell or other magical effect on a creature or an object in the sphere is suppressed while the creature or object is in it.

**Magic Items.** The properties and powers of magic items are suppressed in the sphere.

**Magical Travel.** Teleportation and planar travel fail to work in the sphere, whether the sphere is the destination or the departure point for such magical travel.

**Creatures and Objects.** A creature or object summoned or created by magic temporarily winks out of existence in the sphere.

**Dispel Magic.** Spells and magical effects such as dispel magic have no effect on the sphere.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Clot-Iron filings can substitute for the iron filings. The Sovereigns' divine magic is not suppressed by this spell.

allSpells.name: Antipathy/Sympathy
allSpells.components: V, S, M (either a lump of alum soaked in vinegar for the antipathy effect or a drop of honey for the sympathy effect)
allSpells.description:
This spell attracts or repels creatures of your choice. You target something within range, either a Huge or smaller object or creature or an area that is no larger than a 200-foot cube. Then specify a kind of intelligent creature, such as red dragons, goblins, or vampires. You invest the target with an aura that either attracts or repels the specified creatures for the duration. Choose antipathy or sympathy as the aura's effect.

**Antipathy.** The enchantment causes creatures of the kind you designated to feel an intense urge to leave the area and avoid the target. When such a creature can see the target or comes within 60 feet of it, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened. The creature remains frightened while it can see the target or is within 60 feet of it.

**Sympathy.** The enchantment causes the specified creatures to feel an intense urge to approach the target while within 60 feet of it or able to see it. When such a creature can see the target or comes within 60 feet of it, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or use its movement on each of its turns to enter the area or move within reach of the target.

**Ending the Effect.** If an affected creature ends its turn while not within 60 feet of the target or able to see it, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is no longer affected by the target and recognizes the feeling of repugnance or attraction as magical.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Honey harvested from the Blooming Rot's fungal hives can substitute for the sympathy component.

allSpells.name: Arcane Eye
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of bat fur)
allSpells.description:
You create an invisible, magical eye within range that hovers in the air for the duration.

You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which has normal vision and darkvision out to 30 feet. The eye can look in every direction.

As an action, you can move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. There is no limit to how far away from you the eye can move, but it can't enter another plane of existence. A solid barrier blocks the eye's movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter.

allSpells.name: Arcane Gate
allSpells.description:
You create linked teleportation portals that remain open for the duration. Choose two points on the ground that you can see, one point within 10 feet of you and one point within 500 feet of you. A circular portal, 10 feet in diameter, opens over each point. If the portal would open in the space occupied by a creature, the spell fails.

The portals are two-dimensional glowing rings filled with mist, hovering inches from the ground and perpendicular to it at the points you choose. A ring is visible only from one side (your choice), which is the side that functions as a portal.

Any creature or object entering the portal exits from the other portal as if the two were adjacent to each other.

allSpells.name: Arcane Lock
allSpells.components: V, S, M (gold dust worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
You touch a closed door, window, gate, chest, or other entryway, and it becomes locked for the duration. You and the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can open the object normally. You can also set a password that, when spoken within 5 feet of the object, suppresses this spell for 1 minute. Otherwise, it is impassable until it is broken or the spell is dispelled or suppressed. Casting knock on the object suppresses arcane lock for 10 minutes.

While affected by this spell, the object is more difficult to break or force open; the DC to break it or pick any locks on it increases by 10.

allSpells.name: Armor of Agathys
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a cup of water)
allSpells.description: A protective magical force surrounds you, manifesting as a spectral frost that covers you and your gear. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 cold damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the cold damage increase by 5 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Arms of Hadar
allSpells.description: You invoke the power of Hadar, the Dark Hunger. Tendrils of dark energy erupt from you and batter all creatures within 10 feet of you. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 2d6 necrotic damage and cannot take reactions until its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, but suffers no other effect.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Arterial Puppet
allSpells.description:
You seize control of the blood within a creature you can see. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you can use your reaction at the start of each of the target's turns to force them to move up to 15 feet in a direction you choose. This movement provokes opportunity attacks.

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can also force the target to drop one held item on a failed save.

allSpells.name: Arterial Rebellion
allSpells.description:
You turn a creature's blood against them. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, their blood becomes hostile - they take 4d8 necrotic damage immediately and at the start of each of their turns while the spell persists.

While affected, healing magic is only half as effective on the target, and they have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.

The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns. Creatures without blood are immune.
allSpells.higherLevels: Initial damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

allSpells.name: Ascension of Passion
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a Pseudo-Passion Seed from the Bastion of Fireblood, worth 25,000 gp)
allSpells.description:
You become a lesser avatar of passion. For the duration:

- Immunity to fire damage, resistance to all other damage

- +6d6 fire damage with melee attacks

- 60-foot aura: hostile creatures make Wisdom saves or be affected by their strongest emotion (as Passion's Prisoner)

- Cast Fireball as bonus action without spell slots

- Shed bright light in 120 feet, dim for another 120

**Cost:** When the spell ends, you must make a DC 20 Constitution save or gain 3 levels of exhaustion. This DC represents the strain of containing divine passion, not your own power. Kaedris becomes aware of your existence.

allSpells.name: Ashardalon's Stride
allSpells.description:
The billowing flames of a dragon blast from your feet, granting you explosive speed. For the duration, your speed increases by 20 feet and moving doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

When you move within 5 feet of a creature or an object that isn't being worn or carried, it takes 1d6 fire damage from your trail of fire. A creature or object can take this damage only once during a turn.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, increase your speed by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 3rd. The spell deals an additional 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Astral Projection
allSpells.components: V, S, M (for each creature you affect with this spell, you must provide one jacinth worth at least 1,000 gp and one ornately carved bar of silver worth at least 100 gp, all of which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures within range project your astral bodies into the Astral Plane. The material body you leave behind is unconscious and in a state of suspended animation; it doesn't need food or air and doesn't age.

Your astral body resembles your mortal form in almost every way, replicating your game statistics and possessions. The principal difference is the addition of a silvery cord that extends from between your shoulder blades and trails behind you, fading to invisibility after 1 foot. This cord is your tether to your material body. As long as the tether remains intact, you can find your way home.

Your astral form can freely travel through the Astral Plane and can pass through portals there leading to any other plane. If you enter a new plane or return to the plane you were on when casting this spell, your body and possessions are transported along the silver cord, allowing you to re-enter your body as you enter the new plane.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Jacinths and silver bars bearing the sigils of the Thirteen Sovereigns are particularly effective for this spell.

allSpells.name: Augury
allSpells.components: V, S, M (specially marked sticks, bones, or similar tokens worth at least 25 gp)
allSpells.description:
By casting gem-inlaid sticks, rolling dragon bones, laying out ornate cards, or employing some other divining tool, you receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a specific course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses from the following possible omens:

- Weal, for good results

- Woe, for bad results

- Weal and woe, for both good and bad results

- Nothing, for results that are not especially good or bad

The spell does not take into account any possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the casting of additional spells or the loss or gain of a companion.

If you cast the spell two or more times before completing your next long rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get a random reading. The DM makes this roll in secret.

allSpells.name: Aura of Life
allSpells.description: Life-preserving energy radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) has resistance to necrotic damage, and its hit point maximum can't be reduced. In addition, a nonhostile, living creature regains 1 hit point when it starts its turn in the aura with 0 hit points.

allSpells.name: Aura of Purity
allSpells.description: Purifying energy radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) can't become diseased, has resistance to poison damage, and has advantage on saving throws against effects that cause any of the following conditions: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, and stunned.

allSpells.name: Aura of Vitality
allSpells.description: Healing energy radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. You can use a bonus action to cause one creature in the aura (including you) to regain 2d6 hit points.

allSpells.name: Awaken
allSpells.components: V, S, M (an agate worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
After spending the casting time tracing magical pathways within a precious gemstone, you touch a Huge or smaller beast or plant. The target must have either no Intelligence score or an Intelligence of 3 or less. The target gains an Intelligence of 10. The target also gains the ability to speak one language you know. If the target is a plant, it gains the ability to move its limbs, roots, vines, creepers, and so forth, and it gains senses similar to a human's. Your DM chooses statistics appropriate for the awakened plant, such as the statistics for the awakened shrub or the awakened tree.

The awakened beast or plant is charmed by you for 30 days or until you and your companions do anything harmful to it. When the charmed condition ends, the awakened creature chooses whether to remain friendly to you, based on how you treated it while it was charmed.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A Heart-Stone shard (1,000 gp, consumed) from Veinspire can substitute for the agate. Awakened creatures in the Ashen Realms often take on unsettling characteristics — pale coloration, bioluminescent patches, or fungal growths.

allSpells.name: Azerach's Judgment
allSpells.description:
You invoke the Whispered King's right to claim all who speak truth. The target must make a Constitution saving throw:

- On failure: 12d10 necrotic damage. If this reduces them to 0 HP, their last breath is stolen - they cannot be resurrected except by Wish or True Resurrection, and even then, they can never speak above a whisper again.

- On success: Half damage.

**Special:** If the target has ever told a secret that wasn't theirs to tell, they have disadvantage on the save.

**Sovereign Attention:** Azerach hears this spell cast and judges the caster as well. If you have broken confidence with someone within the past year, you take 4d10 psychic damage.

allSpells.name: Bane
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a drop of blood)
allSpells.description: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Banishing Smite
allSpells.description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, your weapon crackles with force, and the attack deals an extra 5d10 force damage to the target. Additionally, if this attack reduces the target to 50 hit points or fewer, you banish it. If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, the target disappears, returning to its home plane. If the target is native to the plane you're on, the creature vanishes into a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is incapacitated. It remains there until the spell ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

allSpells.name: Banishment
allSpells.components: V, S, M (an item distasteful to the target)
allSpells.description:
You attempt to send one creature that you can see within range to another plane of existence. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished.

If the target is native to the plane of existence you're on, you banish the target to a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is incapacitated. The target remains there until the spell ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, the target is banished with a faint popping noise, returning to its home plane. If the spell ends before 1 minute has passed, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. Otherwise, the target doesn't return.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

allSpells.name: Barkskin
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a handful of oak bark)
allSpells.description: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target's skin has a rough, bark-like appearance, and the target's AC cannot be less than 16, regardless of what kind of armor it is wearing.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Use petrified fungal bark from a Giant Shroom-Tree in place of oak bark.

allSpells.name: Barrier Dome
allSpells.components: V, S, M (silver dust worth 200 gp)
allSpells.description:
You create a protective dome that shields against divine attention. Within the dome:

- Divination magic fails automatically

- Creatures have advantage on saving throws against Sovereign abilities

- Teleportation into the area requires a successful spellcasting ability check against your spell save DC

allSpells.name: Barrier Fortress
allSpells.components: V, S, M (rare metals worth 2,000 gp)
allSpells.description:
You create an impenetrable barrier around a structure up to 100 feet on a side. For the duration:

- No creature can teleport into or out of the structure

- Divination magic targeting the interior fails

- The structure gains resistance to all damage

- Creatures inside have advantage on all saving throws against divine effects

allSpells.name: Barrier Ward
allSpells.description:
You trace symbols that create false information rather than blocking detection. For the duration, any divination magic targeting the warded creature receives plausible but incorrect information - a false name, a wrong location (within 1 mile of actual position), surface thoughts that seem genuine but aren't.

The false information is generated by the spell, not chosen by the caster or target. The warded creature knows when divination magic targets them and what false information was provided.

This ward was designed because Sovereigns eventually learned to notice blocked divinations. False positives are harder to detect than silence.

allSpells.name: Beacon of Hope
allSpells.description: This spell bestows hope and vitality. Choose any number of creatures within range. For the duration, each target has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws, and regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing.

allSpells.name: Beast Bond
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of fur wrapped in a cloth)
allSpells.description: You establish a telepathic link with one beast you touch that is friendly to you or charmed by you. The spell fails if the beast's Intelligence is 4 or higher. Until the spell ends, the link is active while you and the beast are within line of sight of each other. Through the link, the beast can understand your telepathic messages to it, and it can telepathically communicate simple emotions and concepts back to you. While the link is active, the beast gains advantage on attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of you that you can see.

allSpells.name: Beast Sense
allSpells.description: You touch a willing beast. For the duration of the spell, you can use your action to see through the beast's eyes and hear what it hears, and continue to do so until you use your action to return to your normal senses. While perceiving through the beast's senses, you gain the benefits of any special senses possessed by that creature, though you are blinded and deafened to your own surroundings.

allSpells.name: Bestow Curse
allSpells.description:
You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. When you cast this spell, choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

- Choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.

- While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

- While cursed, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing.

- While the target is cursed, your attacks and spells deal an extra 1d8 necrotic damage to the target.

A remove curse spell ends this effect. At the DM's option, you may choose an alternative curse effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above.
allSpells.higherLevels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

allSpells.name: Bigby's Hand
allSpells.components: V, S, M (an eggshell and a snakeskin glove)
allSpells.description:
You create a Large hand of shimmering, translucent force in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The hand lasts for the spell's duration, and it moves at your command, mimicking the movements of your own hand.

The hand is an object that has AC 20 and hit points equal to your hit point maximum. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends. It has a Strength of 26 (+8) and a Dexterity of 10 (+0). The hand doesn't fill its space.

When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on your subsequent turns, you can move the hand up to 60 feet and then cause one of the following effects with it:

**Clenched Fist.** The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand using your game statistics. On a hit, the target takes 4d8 force damage.

**Forceful Hand.** The hand attempts to push a creature within 5 feet of it in a direction you choose. Make a check with the hand's Strength contested by the Strength (Athletics) check of the target. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. If you succeed, the hand pushes the target up to 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to five times your spellcasting ability modifier.

**Grasping Hand.** The hand attempts to grapple a Huge or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. You use the hand's Strength score to resolve the grapple. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. While the hand is grappling the target, you can use a bonus action to have the hand crush it, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to 2d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

**Interposing Hand.** The hand interposes itself between you and a creature you choose until you give the hand a different command. The hand moves to stay between you and the target, providing you with half cover against the target.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage from the clenched fist option increases by 2d8 and the damage from the grasping hand increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 5th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A Cartilage Worm egg sac and a Skin-Walker's shed skin can substitute for the standard components.

allSpells.name: Blade Barrier
allSpells.description:
You create a vertical wall of whirling, razor-sharp blades made of magical energy. The wall appears within range and lasts for the duration. You can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick.

When a creature enters the wall's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 6d10 slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Blades conjured in the Ashen Realms often appear as shards of Arterial Glass or Clot-Iron.

allSpells.name: Blade of the Self
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a blade you have used to draw your own blood)
allSpells.description:
You become a living weapon. For the duration:

- Your unarmed strikes deal 4d12 slashing damage + your spellcasting modifier

- You have advantage on all attack rolls

- Your AC equals 10 + Dexterity modifier + your spellcasting modifier

- You can make two additional attacks as part of the Attack action

- When you reduce a creature to 0 HP, you regain 20 HP

**Cost:** At the end of each of your turns, you take 2d10 slashing damage as your body cuts itself in its pursuit of perfection. This damage cannot be reduced.

allSpells.name: Blade Ward
allSpells.description: You extend your hand and trace a sigil of warding in the air. Until the end of your next turn, you have resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by weapon attacks.

allSpells.name: Bless
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a sprinkling of holy water)
allSpells.description: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Blight
allSpells.description:
Necromantic energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes 8d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw; it simply withers and dies.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This spell is particularly effective against fungal creatures in the Ashen Realms, causing them to dessicate and crumble.

allSpells.name: Blinding Smite
allSpells.description:
The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon flares with bright light, and the attack deals an extra 3d8 radiant damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the spell ends.

A creature blinded by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer blinded.

allSpells.name: Blindness/Deafness
allSpells.description: You can blind or deafen a foe. Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is either blinded or deafened (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Blink
allSpells.description:
Roll a d20 at the end of each of your turns for the duration of the spell. On a roll of 11 or higher, you vanish from your current plane of existence and appear in the Ethereal Plane (the spell fails and the casting is wasted if you were already on that plane). At the start of your next turn, and when the spell ends if you are on the Ethereal Plane, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of the space you vanished from. If no unoccupied space is available within that range, you appear in the nearest unoccupied space (chosen at random if more than one space is equally near). You can dismiss this spell as an action.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and hear the plane you originated from, which is cast in shades of gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away. You can only affect and be affected by other creatures on the Ethereal Plane. Creatures that aren't there can't perceive you or interact with you, unless they have the ability to do so.

allSpells.name: Blood Covenant
allSpells.components: V, S, M (blood from all parties, 1,000 gp worth of rubies, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You forge an unbreakable blood bond between willing creatures. All participants gain:

- If one drops to 0 HP, others can sacrifice HP to stabilize them

- Sense each other's emotional state and direction at any distance

- Advantage on saves against effects that would turn them against each other

**The Covenant's Price:** If any participant breaks a specific condition set during the ritual, they immediately take 10d10 necrotic damage and are marked as covenant-breakers - visible to Mareatha's servants forever.

allSpells.name: Blood Dominion
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a vial of divine blood worth 5,000 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You assert control over the blood of all creatures in range. Choose one:

**Mass Arterial Puppet:** Up to 10 creatures make Constitution saves. On failure, you control their movement (30 feet per turn, no action required). Repeat save each round.

**Blood Tide Rising:** All creatures with blood take 4d6 necrotic at start of their turns and have disadvantage on Constitution saves. Successful Constitution save (as action) ends for that creature.

**Sanguine Mastery:** For the duration, use your action to puppeteer any creature with blood within range (Constitution save negates, repeatable).

allSpells.name: Blood Price
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a drop of your own blood, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You offer your blood to fuel destruction. Take 1d6 necrotic damage (this cannot be reduced or prevented). A creature you can see within range must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

For each additional 1d6 necrotic damage you choose to take (up to 3d6 total), the spell's damage increases by 2d8.
allSpells.higherLevels: The base damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Blood Tide
allSpells.description:
A wave of boiling blood surges forth from you. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half on success.

Creatures who fail are covered in clinging blood. Until they spend an action cleaning it off, they leave a visible trail, have disadvantage on Stealth checks, and can be tracked by Mareatha's servants from any distance.
allSpells.higherLevels: Damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

allSpells.name: Blur
allSpells.description: Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it does not rely on sight, as with blindsight, or can see through illusions, as with truesight.

allSpells.name: Blur the Records
allSpells.components: V, S, M (dust from an old document)
allSpells.description:
You become harder to remember precisely. For the duration, creatures who observe you cannot accurately describe your appearance after you leave their sight. They remember that someone was there, and can recall what you did and said, but your face, build, and distinguishing features become vague and contradictory in their memory.

This doesn't affect magical observation or creatures with perfect memory (such as Modrons or some constructs).

allSpells.name: Bone Cage
allSpells.description:
Ribs of calcite bone erupt from the ground in a 5-foot radius circle centered on a point you can see. Creatures in the area when the cage forms must make a Dexterity saving throw or be restrained inside the cage.

A restrained creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, breaking free on a success. The cage can also be destroyed (AC 12, 15 HP, immunity to poison and psychic damage).

The bones are warm to the touch - they remember being alive.
allSpells.higherLevels: The cage's HP increases by 10 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Bone Sculpture
allSpells.components: V, S, M (bones or skeletal remains of Medium size or larger)
allSpells.description:
You reshape bones into useful forms. You can create any nonmagical item made of bone, including:

- Weapons (treat as their normal type but made of bone; deal an additional 1 necrotic damage)

- Armor (up to medium armor; AC as normal)

- Tools or equipment

- Structures up to 10 cubic feet

Items created are permanent and have the same durability as their normal equivalents. They feel warm to the touch and occasionally creak as if settling.
allSpells.higherLevels: You can work with an additional 10 cubic feet of bone for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Bones of the Earth
allSpells.description:
You cause up to six pillars of stone to burst from places on the ground that you can see within range. Each pillar is a cylinder that has a diameter of 5 feet and a height of up to 30 feet. The ground where a pillar appears must be wide enough for its diameter.

If a pillar is created under a creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be lifted by the pillar. A creature can choose to fail the save.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can create two additional pillars for each slot level above 6th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Near the Ossuary Kingdom, these pillars often appear as columns of fused bone rather than stone.

allSpells.name: Booming Blade
allSpells.components: S, M (a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp)
allSpells.description: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes sheathed in booming energy until the start of your next turn. If the target willingly moves 5 feet or more before then, the target takes 1d8 thunder damage, and the spell ends.
allSpells.higherLevels: At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra 1d8 thunder damage to the target on a hit, and the damage the target takes for moving increases to 2d8. Both damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 11th level (2d8 and 3d8) and again at 17th level (3d8 and 4d8).

allSpells.name: Borrowed Time
allSpells.description:
You steal seconds from your own future. You immediately gain an additional action, which can be used to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

**Cost:** At the start of your next turn, you lose your action as time catches up. You can still move, use bonus actions, and reactions. You also age 1 year (this aging is real and can only be reversed by Greater Restoration, Wish, or Imhuran's direct intervention).

**Sovereign Attention:** Imhuran notices when mortals tamper with their allotted time.

allSpells.name: Boundary Blur
allSpells.description: You blur the boundary between yourself and shadow. For the duration, you have advantage on Stealth checks in dim light or darkness, and when in darkness, you can use a bonus action to teleport up to 30 feet to another area of darkness you can see.

allSpells.name: Branding Smite
allSpells.description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike. The attack deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage to the target, which becomes visible if it is invisible, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and cannot become invisible until the spell ends.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Breath of Annihilation
allSpells.description:
You exhale the silence that ends all things. All creatures in a 90-foot cone must make Constitution saving throws:

- On failure: 14d10 necrotic damage. If reduced to 0 HP, the creature's final breath is stolen - they cannot be resurrected by any means short of Wish, and even then they return mute.

- On success: Half damage.

Additionally, all sound within the cone ceases permanently. The area becomes a zone of absolute silence that cannot be dispelled except by Wish or a Sovereign's intervention. Creatures within this zone cannot speak, hear, or cast spells with verbal components.

**Sovereign Attention:** Azerach experiences this spell directly. He may choose to claim one creature killed by it as a servant.

allSpells.name: Breath of Nothing
allSpells.description:
You exhale the silence between breaths. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On failure:

- 8d8 necrotic damage

- Cannot speak or breathe for 1 minute (can hold breath, but verbal spellcasting is impossible)

- Deafened for the duration

On success, half damage only.

**Sovereign Attention:** Azerach hears every gasp for air this spell creates.

allSpells.name: Burning Hands
allSpells.description:
As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a thin sheet of flames shoots forth from your outstretched fingernails. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that are not being worn or carried.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Call Lightning
allSpells.description:
A storm cloud appears in the shape of a cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 60-foot radius, centered on a point you can see within range directly above you. The spell fails if you can't see a point in the air where the storm cloud could appear.

When you cast the spell, choose a point you can see under the cloud. A bolt of lightning flashes down from the cloud to that point. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d10 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to call down lightning in this way again, targeting the same point or a different one.

If you are outdoors in stormy conditions when you cast this spell, the spell gives you control over the existing storm instead of creating a new one. Under such conditions, the spell's damage increases by 1d10.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 3rd.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the cavernous depths of the Ashen Realms, this spell draws upon the static energy that builds within the Ash Storms, manifesting as crackling bolts of gray-tinged lightning.

allSpells.name: Call the Unmourned
allSpells.components: V, S, M (grave goods that were never given to the dead, worth 500 gp)
allSpells.description:
You summon the spirits of those who died unmourned, forgotten, or alone. A number of Specters equal to your spellcasting modifier appear within range. Unlike normal Specters, these are not hostile - they are grateful to be remembered.

The spirits obey your commands, can scout invisibly, and can communicate telepathically with you. They cannot attack living creatures unless those creatures threaten you.

When the spell ends, the spirits thank you and fade. If you treated them with respect, you have advantage on the next Ancestral spell you cast within 24 hours.

allSpells.name: Calm Emotions
allSpells.description:
You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, choose one of the following two effects.

You can suppress any effect causing a target to be charmed or frightened. When this spell ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

Alternatively, you can make a target indifferent about creatures of your choice that it is hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the spell ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the DM rules otherwise.

allSpells.name: Cantrips
allSpells.description:
You touch a bone or skeletal remain and learn one fact about the creature it came from: their species, approximate age at death, cause of death, or how long ago they died.

If the bone belonged to a creature that died violently, you experience a flash of their final emotion - not a memory, but a feeling. This can be overwhelming if the death was particularly traumatic (DC 10 Wisdom save or be shaken, disadvantage on your next attack roll).

allSpells.name: Cardiac Arrest
allSpells.description:
You seize a creature's heart. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On failure:

- 8d10 necrotic damage

- Paralyzed as heart stops

- 4d10 necrotic damage at start of each turn

The target (or ally within 5 feet) can use an action for a Medicine check against your spell save DC to restart the heart, ending the spell. The target can also repeat the Constitution save at end of each turn.

Creatures without hearts are immune.
allSpells.higherLevels: Initial damage increases by 2d10 for each slot level above 6th.

allSpells.name: Catapult
allSpells.description: Choose one object weighing 1 to 5 pounds within range that is not being worn or carried. The object flies in a straight line up to 90 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the object strikes the target and stops moving. When the object strikes something, the object and what it strikes each take 3d8 bludgeoning damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the maximum weight of objects that you can target with this spell increases by 5 pounds, and the damage increases by 1d8, for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Catnap
allSpells.description: You make a calming gesture, and up to three willing creatures of your choice that you can see within range fall unconscious for the spell's duration. The spell ends on a target early if it takes damage or someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. If a target remains unconscious for the full duration, that target gains the benefit of a short rest, and it can't be affected by this spell again until it finishes a long rest.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional willing creature for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Cause Fear
allSpells.description: You awaken the sense of mortality in one creature you can see within range. A construct or an undead is immune to this effect. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the spell ends. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Ceremony
allSpells.components: V, S, M (25 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
You perform a special religious ceremony that is infused with magic. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following rites, the target of which must be within 10 feet of you throughout the casting.

**Atonement.** You touch one willing creature whose alignment has changed, and you make a DC 20 Wisdom (Insight) check. On a successful check, you restore the target to its original alignment.

**Bless Water.** You touch one vial of water and cause it to become holy water.

**Coming of Age.** You touch one humanoid who is a young adult. For the next 24 hours, whenever the target makes an ability check, it can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

**Dedication.** You touch one humanoid who wishes to be dedicated to your god's service. For the next 24 hours, whenever the target makes a saving throw, it can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the save. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

**Funeral Rite.** You touch one corpse, and for the next 7 days, the target cannot become undead by any means short of a wish spell.

**Wedding.** You touch adult humanoids willing to be bonded together in marriage. For the next 7 days, each target gains a +2 bonus to AC while they are within 30 feet of each other. A creature can benefit from this rite again only if widowed.

allSpells.name: Chain Lightning
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of fur; a piece of amber, glass, or a crystal rod; and three silver pins)
allSpells.description:
You create a bolt of lightning that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.

A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 10d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional bolt leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Bloom Hound fur, Arterial Glass, and Marrow-Silver pins can substitute for the standard components.

allSpells.name: Chaos Bolt
allSpells.description:
You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 + 1d6 damage. Choose one of the d8s. The number rolled on that die determines the damage type.

| d8 | Damage Type |

|----|-------------|

| 1 | Acid |

| 2 | Cold |

| 3 | Fire |

| 4 | Force |

| 5 | Lightning |

| 6 | Poison |

| 7 | Psychic |

| 8 | Thunder |

If you roll the same number on both d8s, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 30 feet of it. Make a new attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again. A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, each target takes 1d6 extra damage of the type rolled for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Charm Monster
allSpells.description: You attempt to charm a creature you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and it does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is charmed by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature is friendly to you. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

allSpells.name: Charm Person
allSpells.description: You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is charmed by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

allSpells.name: Chill Touch
allSpells.description: You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target. If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.
allSpells.higherLevels: This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

allSpells.name: Chromatic Orb
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 50 gp)
allSpells.description: You hurl a 4-inch-diameter sphere of energy at a creature that you can see within range. You choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder for the type of orb you create, and then make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes 3d8 damage of the type you chose.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Circle of Death
allSpells.components: V, S, M (the powder of a crushed black pearl worth at least 500 gp)
allSpells.description: A sphere of negative energy ripples out in a 60-foot-radius sphere from a point within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 6th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Void-Dust from the Devoured Courts can substitute for the black pearl powder.

allSpells.name: Circle of Power
allSpells.description:
Divine energy radiates from you, distorting and diffusing magical energy within 30 feet of you. Until the spell ends, the sphere moves with you, centered on you. For the duration, each friendly creature in the area (including you) has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Additionally, when an affected creature succeeds on a saving throw made against a spell or magical effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw.

allSpells.name: Clairvoyance
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a focus worth at least 100 gp, either a jeweled horn for hearing or a glass eye for seeing)
allSpells.description:
You create an invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you. The sensor remains in place for the duration, and it can't be attacked or otherwise interacted with.

When you cast the spell, you choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As your action, you can switch between seeing and hearing.

A creature that can see the sensor sees a luminous, intangible orb about the size of your fist.

allSpells.name: Clockwork Prison
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a perfect gear worth 5,000 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You trap a creature in a personal time loop. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure, they vanish into a pocket dimension where time loops endlessly.

The target experiences 1 minute, then returns to the exact moment they were captured, experiencing the same minute again. They retain memories between loops and can attempt a Wisdom save at the end of each loop to escape.

From outside, the target simply vanishes until they escape or the spell is dispelled.

**Cost:** The caster ages 1 year upon casting.

allSpells.name: Clockwork Recursion
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction (when you miss an attack roll or fail a saving throw)
allSpells.description:
Time stutters backward. You reroll the triggering attack roll or saving throw and must use the new result.

**Cost:** You age 1d4 years. This aging is real (not cosmetic) and can only be reversed by Greater Restoration, Wish, or Imhuran's direct intervention. If this aging would exceed your natural lifespan, you take 6d10 necrotic damage instead.

allSpells.name: Clone
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 1,000 gp and at least 1 cubic inch of flesh of the creature that is to be cloned, which the spell consumes, and a vessel worth at least 2,000 gp that has a sealable lid and is large enough to hold a Medium creature)
allSpells.description:
This spell grows an inert duplicate of a living creature as a safeguard against death. This clone forms inside a sealed vessel and grows to full size and maturity after 120 days; you can also choose to have the clone be a younger version of the same creature. It remains inert and endures indefinitely, as long as its vessel remains undisturbed.

At any time after the clone matures, if the original creature dies, its soul transfers to the clone, provided that the soul is free and willing to return. The clone is physically identical to the original and has the same personality, memories, and abilities, but none of the original's equipment. The original creature's physical remains, if they still exist, become inert and can't thereafter be restored to life, since the creature's soul is elsewhere.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Heart-Stone worth 1,000 gp can substitute for the diamond. The Ossuary Kingdom's necromancers have perfected variations of this spell.

allSpells.name: Cloud of Daggers
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a sliver of glass)
allSpells.description: You fill the air with spinning daggers in a cube 5 feet on each side, centered on a point you choose within range. A creature takes 4d4 slashing damage when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Cloudkill
allSpells.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of poisonous, yellow-green fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell. Its area is heavily obscured.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 5d8 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

The fog moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: The toxic spore clouds of the Blooming Rot often inspire this spell's manifestation, appearing as sickly yellow-green with traces of bioluminescence.

allSpells.name: Color Spray
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of powder or sand that is colored red, yellow, and blue)
allSpells.description:
A dazzling array of flashing, colored light springs from your hand. Roll 6d10; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures in a 15-foot cone originating from you are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures and creatures that cannot see).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell is blinded until the spell ends. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d10 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Command
allSpells.description:
