allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the bonus to attack rolls increases to +2 and the extra damage increases to 2d4. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3 and the extra damage increases to 3d4.

allSpells.name: Enemies Abound
allSpells.description:
You reach into the mind of one creature you can see and force it to make an Intelligence saving throw. A creature automatically succeeds if it is immune to being frightened. On a failed save, the target loses the ability to distinguish friend from foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies until the spell ends. Each time the target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Whenever the affected creature chooses another creature as a target, it must choose the target at random from among the creatures it can see within range of the attack, spell, or other ability it's using. If an enemy provokes an opportunity attack from the affected creature, the creature must make that attack if it is able to.

allSpells.name: Enhance Ability
allSpells.components: V, S, M (fur or a feather from a beast)
allSpells.description:
You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose one of the following effects; the target gains that effect until the spell ends.

**Bear's Endurance.** The target has advantage on Constitution checks. It also gains 2d6 temporary hit points, which are lost when the spell ends.

**Bull's Strength.** The target has advantage on Strength checks, and his or her carrying capacity doubles.

**Cat's Grace.** The target has advantage on Dexterity checks. It also does not take damage from falling 20 feet or less if it is not incapacitated.

**Eagle's Splendor.** The target has advantage on Charisma checks.

**Fox's Cunning.** The target has advantage on Intelligence checks.

**Owl's Wisdom.** The target has advantage on Wisdom checks.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Enlarge/Reduce
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of powdered iron)
allSpells.description:
You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.

**Enlarge.** The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category. The target also has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, the target's attacks with them deal 1d4 extra damage.

**Reduce.** The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one category. The target also has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these weapons are reduced, the target's attacks with them deal 1d4 less damage (this cannot reduce the damage below 1).

allSpells.name: Ensnaring Strike
allSpells.description:
The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, a writhing mass of thorny vines appears at the point of impact, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained by the magical vines until the spell ends. A Large or larger creature has advantage on this saving throw. If the target succeeds on the save, the vines shrivel away.

While restrained by this spell, the target takes 1d6 piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature restrained by the vines or one that can touch the creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the target is freed.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Entangle
allSpells.description:
Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained by the entangling plants until the spell ends. A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

When the spell ends, the conjured plants wilt away.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, the conjured plants manifest as grasping fungal tendrils and Rot-Moss rather than living vines.

allSpells.name: Enthrall
allSpells.description: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range and that can hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature that cannot be charmed succeeds on this saving throw automatically, and if you or your companions are fighting a creature, it has advantage on the save. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive any creature other than you until the spell ends or until the target can no longer hear you. The spell ends if you are incapacitated or can no longer speak.

allSpells.name: Entropic Acceleration
allSpells.description:
You accelerate decay. Choose a creature or object within range:

**Creature:** The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On failure, they age 2d10 years and take 6d8 necrotic damage. On success, half damage, no aging. While the spell persists, they take 2d8 necrotic damage at the start of each turn (no save) and can use their action to attempt another Constitution save, ending the spell on success.

**Object:** A nonmagical object up to 10 cubic feet decays completely - wood rots, metal rusts, stone crumbles. Magical objects get a save using their creator's modifier.

allSpells.name: Erasure Trail
allSpells.components: V, S, M (something that belonged to a forgotten person)
allSpells.description:
You attune yourself to the traces left by someone who was erased - consumed by Vor'Kael, expunged from records, or otherwise removed from existence. For the duration, you can see faint afterimages where the forgotten person once stood, touched, or traveled.

The trail is often fragmentary and confusing, as reality has partially healed around the erasure.

allSpells.name: Erupting Earth
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a piece of obsidian)
allSpells.description: Choose a point you can see on the ground within range. A fountain of churned earth and stone erupts in a 20-foot cube centered on that point. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d12 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, the ground in that area becomes difficult terrain until cleared. Each 5-foot-square portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 3rd.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, this spell causes volcanic ash and hardite stone to erupt rather than earth.

allSpells.name: Eternity's Weight
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pocket watch that has run for exactly 100 years, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You impose the full weight of time. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure:

- Age 10d10 years immediately

- Paralyzed for the duration, experiencing every moment of those years in subjective time

- 4d10 psychic damage at start of each turn

Repeat save at end of each turn, but even on success, the aging is permanent (reversible only by Wish or Imhuran's intervention).

**Cost:** You age 1d10 years when you cast this spell.

allSpells.name: Etherealness
allSpells.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, in the area where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration or until you use your action to dismiss the spell. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can see and hear the plane you originated from, but everything there looks gray, and you can't see anything more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive you and can't interact with you, unless a special ability or magic has given them the ability to do so.

You ignore all objects and effects that aren't on the Ethereal Plane, allowing you to move through objects you perceive on the plane you originated from.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can target up to three willing creatures (including you) for each slot level above 7th. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.
allSpells.ashenRealms: The Border Ethereal in the Ashen Realms is tinged with the essence of the Devoured Courts—echoes of absence and hunger.

allSpells.name: Evard's Black Tentacles
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a piece of tentacle from a giant octopus or a giant squid)
allSpells.description:
Squirming, ebony tentacles fill a 20-foot square on ground that you can see within range. For the duration, these tentacles turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 bludgeoning damage and be restrained by the tentacles until the spell ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already restrained by the tentacles takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage.

A creature restrained by the tentacles can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A preserved tendril from a Cartilage Worm or piece of Mycelium Thread can substitute for the tentacle component.

allSpells.name: Expeditious Retreat
allSpells.description: This spell allows you to move at an incredible pace. When you cast this spell, and then as a bonus action on each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take the Dash action.

allSpells.name: Eyebite
allSpells.description:
For the spell's duration, your eyes become an inky void imbued with dread power. One creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects of your choice for the duration. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to target another creature but can't target a creature again if it has succeeded on a saving throw against this casting of eyebite.

- **Asleep:** The target falls unconscious. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature uses its action to shake the sleeper awake.

- **Panicked:** The target is frightened of you. On each of its turns, the frightened creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest and shortest available route.

- **Sickened:** The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. At the end of each of its turns, it can make another Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, the effect ends.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Near the Devoured Courts, casters' eyes often manifest the Hollow Crown's empty gaze.

allSpells.name: Fabricate
allSpells.description:
You convert raw materials into products of the same material. For example, you can fabricate a wooden bridge from a clump of trees, a rope from a patch of hemp, and clothes from flax or wool.

Choose raw materials that you can see within range. You can fabricate a Large or smaller object (contained within a 10-foot cube, or eight connected 5-foot cubes), given a sufficient quantity of raw material. If you are working with metal, stone, or another mineral substance, however, the fabricated object can be no larger than Medium (contained within a single 5-foot cube). The quality of objects made by the spell is commensurate with the quality of the raw materials.

Creatures or magic items can't be created or transmuted by this spell. You also can't use it to create items that ordinarily require a high degree of craftsmanship, such as jewelry, weapons, glass, or armor, unless you have proficiency with the type of artisan's tools used to craft such objects.

allSpells.name: Faerie Fire
allSpells.description:
Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object cannot benefit from being invisible.
allSpells.ashenRealms: The light manifests with a pale, ghostly quality reminiscent of Luminescent Rot-Moss.

allSpells.name: False Life
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a small amount of alcohol or distilled spirits)
allSpells.description: Bolstering yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life, you gain 1d4 + 4 temporary hit points for the duration.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain 5 additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Far Step
allSpells.description: You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. On each of your turns before the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to teleport in this way again.

allSpells.name: Fear
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a white feather or the heart of a hen)
allSpells.description:
You project a phantasmal image of a creature's worst fears. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become frightened for the duration.

While frightened by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

allSpells.name: Feather Fall
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction, which you take when you or a creature within 60 feet of you falls
allSpells.components: V, M (a small feather or piece of down)
allSpells.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If the creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the spell ends for that creature.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Use a tuft of Ash-Moth down or similar material from the Ashen Realms.

allSpells.name: Feeblemind
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a handful of clay, crystal, glass, or mineral spheres)
allSpells.description:
You blast the mind of a creature that you can see within range, attempting to shatter its intellect and personality. The target takes 4d6 psychic damage and must make an Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them.

At the end of every 30 days, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this spell. If it succeeds on its saving throw, the spell ends. The spell can also be ended by greater restoration, heal, or wish.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Void-Dust mixed with the spheres enhances the spell's potency against creatures of the Devoured Courts.

allSpells.name: Feign Death
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of graveyard dirt)
allSpells.description:
You touch a willing creature and put it into a cataleptic state that is indistinguishable from death.

For the spell's duration, or until you use an action to touch the target and dismiss the spell, the target appears dead to all outward inspection and to spells used to determine the target's status. The target is blinded and incapacitated, and its speed drops to 0. The target has resistance to all damage except psychic damage. If the target is diseased or poisoned when you cast the spell, or becomes diseased or poisoned while under the spell's effect, the disease and poison have no effect until the spell ends.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Powdered Death-Cap mushroom can substitute for graveyard dirt.

allSpells.name: Final Harmony
allSpells.description:
You sing reality into compliance. Within 1 mile:

- Gravity obeys your will: increase, decrease, reverse, or nullify in any 30-foot area as bonus action

- Sound becomes solid: create structures of solidified sound (AC 18, 50 HP per 10-foot cube)

- Feel the emotional state of every creature; amplify or suppress any emotion with a thought (Wisdom save to resist)

- Discord is impossible: creatures cannot lie, break promises, or act against stated intentions

**Cost:** When the spell ends, you are deafened and mute for 1d4 days.

allSpells.name: Find Familiar
allSpells.components: V, S, M (10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier)
allSpells.description:
You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose: bat, cat, crab, frog (toad), hawk, lizard, octopus, owl, poisonous snake, fish (quipper), rat, raven, sea horse, spider, or weasel. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of a beast.

Your familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar cannot attack, but it can take other actions as normal.

When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again. While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

As an action, you can temporarily dismiss your familiar. It disappears into a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

You cannot have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new form.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

allSpells.name: Find Greater Steed
allSpells.description:
You summon a spirit that assumes the form of a loyal, majestic mount. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the spirit takes on a form you choose: a griffon, a pegasus, a peryton, a dire wolf, a rhinoceros, or a saber-toothed tiger. The creature has the statistics provided in the Monster Manual for the chosen form, though it is a celestial, a fey, or a fiend (your choice) instead of its normal creature type. Additionally, if it has an Intelligence score of 5 or lower, its Intelligence becomes 6, and it gains the ability to understand one language of your choice that you speak.

You control the mount in combat. While the mount is within 1 mile of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. While mounted on it, you can make any spell you cast that targets only you also target the mount.

The mount disappears temporarily when it drops to 0 hit points or when you dismiss it as an action. Casting this spell again re-summons the bonded mount, with all its hit points restored and any conditions removed.

You can't have more than one mount bonded by this spell or find steed at the same time. As an action, you can release a mount from its bond, causing it to disappear permanently. Whenever the mount disappears, it leaves behind any objects it was wearing or carrying.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, the summoned mount often takes on characteristics of the local domain — bone-plated steeds near the Ossuary Kingdom, fungal-covered mounts near the Blooming Rot, etc.

allSpells.name: Find Steed
allSpells.description:
You summon a spirit that assumes the form of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed, creating a long-lasting bond with it. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the steed takes on a form that you choose: a warhorse, a pony, a camel, an elk, or a mastiff. The steed has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of its normal type. Additionally, if your steed has an Intelligence of 5 or less, its Intelligence becomes 6, and it gains the ability to understand one language of your choice that you speak.

Your steed serves you as a mount, both in combat and out, and you have an instinctive bond with it that allows you to fight as a seamless unit. While mounted on your steed, you can make any spell you cast that targets only you also target your steed.

When the steed drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. You can also dismiss your steed at any time as an action, causing it to disappear. In either case, casting this spell again summons the same steed, restored to its hit point maximum.

While your steed is within 1 mile of you, you can communicate with it telepathically.

You cannot have more than one steed bonded by this spell at a time. As an action, you can release the steed from its bond at any time, causing it to disappear.

allSpells.name: Find the Path
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a set of divinatory tools worth 100 gp and an object from the location you wish to find)
allSpells.description:
This spell allows you to find the shortest, most direct physical route to a specific fixed location that you are familiar with on the same plane of existence. If you name a destination on another plane of existence, a destination that moves, or a destination that isn't specific, the spell fails.

For the duration, as long as you are on the same plane of existence as the destination, you know how far it is and in what direction it lies. While you are traveling there, whenever you are presented with a choice of paths along the way, you automatically determine which path is the shortest and most direct route (but not necessarily the safest route) to the destination.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Divinatory bones from the Ossuary Kingdom and a relic from the destination location can substitute.

allSpells.name: Find Traps
allSpells.description:
You sense the presence of any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap, for the purpose of this spell, includes anything that would inflict a sudden or unexpected effect you consider harmful or undesirable, which was specifically intended as such by its creator. Thus, the spell would sense an area affected by the alarm spell, a glyph of warding, or a mechanical pit trap, but it would not reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole.

This spell merely reveals that a trap is present. You do not learn the location of each trap, but you do learn the general nature of the danger posed by a trap you sense.

allSpells.name: Finger of Death
allSpells.description:
You send negative energy coursing through a creature that you can see within range, causing it searing pain. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes 7d8 + 30 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A humanoid killed by this spell rises at the start of your next turn as a zombie that is permanently under your command, following your verbal orders to the best of its ability.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This spell resonates strongly with the necromantic energies of the Ossuary Kingdom and the Devoured Courts.

allSpells.name: Fire Bolt
allSpells.description: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.
allSpells.higherLevels: This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

allSpells.name: Fire Shield
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of phosphorus or a firefly)
allSpells.description:
Thin and wispy flames wreathe your body for the duration, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

The flames provide you with a warm shield or a chill shield, as you choose. The warm shield grants you resistance to cold damage, and the chill shield grants you resistance to fire damage.

In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the shield erupts with flame. The attacker takes 2d8 fire damage from a warm shield, or 2d8 cold damage from a cold shield.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Ember-Salt from the Bastion of Fireblood can substitute for phosphorus, while Luminescent Rot-Moss can substitute for a firefly.

allSpells.name: Fire Storm
allSpells.description:
A storm made up of sheets of roaring flame appears in a location you choose within range. The area of the storm consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 7d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried. If you choose, plant life in the area is unaffected by this spell.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Near the Bastion of Fireblood, these flames burn with an intense blood-red hue.

allSpells.name: Fireball
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur)
allSpells.description:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Flame Arrows
allSpells.description: You touch a quiver containing arrows or bolts. When a target is hit by a ranged weapon attack using a piece of ammunition drawn from the quiver, the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage. The spell's magic ends on a piece of ammunition when it hits or misses, and the spell ends when twelve pieces of ammunition have been drawn from the quiver.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of pieces of ammunition you can affect with this spell increases by two for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Flame Blade
allSpells.description:
You evoke a fiery blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the fiery blade. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 fire damage.

The flaming blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every two slot levels above 2nd.
allSpells.ashenRealms: The leaf of sumac can be replaced with dried Cinder-Fungus.

allSpells.name: Flame Strike
allSpells.description: A vertical column of divine fire roars down from the heavens in a location you specify. Each creature in a 10-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 4d6 fire damage and 4d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage or the radiant damage (your choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Ember-Salt from the Bastion of Fireblood can substitute for sulfur.

allSpells.name: Flaming Sphere
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of tallow, a pinch of brimstone, and a dusting of powdered iron)
allSpells.description:
A 5-foot-diameter sphere of fire appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere's damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn.

When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide. The sphere ignites flammable objects not being worn or carried, and it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Flaw Exploitation
allSpells.description:
You see the imperfections in all things. Choose a creature you can see. For the duration:

- You know their lowest ability score, current HP, and any vulnerabilities or resistances

- Your attacks against them score critical hits on 19-20

- When you hit them, you can choose to deal normal damage OR inflict a lasting wound (their speed is halved, OR they have disadvantage on attacks, OR they can't take reactions) - save ends

- Once per turn when they miss an attack or fail a check, you can use your reaction to mock them, dealing 3d6 psychic damage

**Sovereign Attention:** Aral-Vyn appreciates those who expose weakness.

allSpells.name: Flawless Devastation
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a surgical blade blessed by Aral-Vyn's Crucible, worth 25,000 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You channel the Bladed Saint's hatred of imperfection to unmake a creature or object.

**Against a creature:** The target makes a Constitution saving throw. You identify their greatest flaw - physical, mental, or spiritual - and exploit it utterly:

- On failure, the flaw is amplified catastrophically: a weak heart stops, a cracked mind shatters, an old wound reopens. They take 20d6 damage of a type matching their flaw (piercing for physical, psychic for mental, necrotic for spiritual) and gain a permanent injury related to the flaw (GM's discretion).

- On success, half damage, no permanent injury.

**Against an object:** The object is destroyed perfectly - it shatters along every flaw line simultaneously, leaving only dust. Magical objects get a save using their creator's spellcasting modifier.

**Sovereign Attention:** Aral-Vyn watches every imperfection destroyed. He may mark particularly thorough casters for his attention.

allSpells.name: Flesh Armor
allSpells.description:
Your skin thickens with the world's resilience. For the duration:

- Your AC cannot be lower than 16 (natural armor)

- You have resistance to piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

- You have advantage on saving throws against disease and poison

When the spell ends, you shed a layer of dead skin.

allSpells.name: Flesh Communion
allSpells.description:
You place your hands on the ground and commune with the world's body. You can ask the world 3 questions about the surrounding area (1 mile radius):

- Where are the largest concentrations of life?

- What paths do creatures frequently travel?

- Are there any locations of significant death or violence?

- Is there Sovereign corruption nearby?

- Where is fresh water?

The world answers in sensations, not words - warmth for life, cold for death, discomfort for corruption.

allSpells.name: Flesh Crucible
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a surgical blade worth at least 100 gp)
allSpells.description:
You transform a willing creature's body, refining it through pain. Choose two:

- +2 to Strength score (to a maximum of 22)

- +2 to Dexterity score (to a maximum of 22)

- +2 to Constitution score (to a maximum of 22)

- Natural armor (AC equals 13 + Dexterity modifier)

- Natural weapons (unarmed strikes deal 1d8 + Strength slashing)

The transformation is agonizing. The target takes 4d6 psychic damage when the spell is cast and when it ends.

**Sovereign Attention:** Aral-Vyn notices all who seek perfection through pain.

allSpells.name: Flesh Dominion
allSpells.components: V, S, M (the preserved heart of a giant creature)
allSpells.description:
You gain absolute control over flesh within range. For the duration:

- All creatures with organic bodies must make Constitution saves at the start of each turn or be paralyzed until the start of their next turn

- You can reshape any willing creature's body as you choose (as True Polymorph, but only to humanoid or beast forms)

- Healing magic you cast heals the maximum amount

- You are immune to all damage from creatures with organic bodies

allSpells.name: Flesh Golem
allSpells.components: V, S, M (organic material weighing at least 100 pounds)
allSpells.description:
You animate flesh into a servant. The golem uses the statistics of an Ogre but has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks. It obeys your verbal commands and acts on its own initiative.

When the spell ends, the golem collapses into inanimate flesh.

allSpells.name: Flesh Knit
allSpells.description:
You knit two pieces of flesh together - whether they originally belonged together or not. This spell has several applications:

**Reattach Limb:** A severed limb can be reattached if both pieces are present and the separation occurred within 1 hour.

**Graft Tissue:** You can graft flesh from one willing creature onto another - skin to cover burns, muscle to replace damaged tissue. The graft takes permanently but may look visibly different from surrounding flesh.

**Seal Wound:** Close a single wound, preventing further bleeding and granting advantage on the next death saving throw if the creature is dying.

**Bind Creatures:** With two willing creatures, you can temporarily fuse them at a point of contact (hands held, shoulders touching). They cannot be separated by non-magical means for 1 hour. Either can end the effect early by taking 2d6 necrotic damage.

allSpells.name: Flesh Mastery
allSpells.description:
You gain complete control over a willing creature's flesh. For the duration, you can:

- Reshape their body (as Alter Self, but more extreme)

- Grant them resistance to one damage type of your choice

- Increase or decrease their size by one category

- Grant them natural weapons (2d8 damage) or natural armor (AC 18)

Multiple modifications can be active simultaneously.

allSpells.name: Flesh Meld
allSpells.description:
You merge with the world's flesh. You step into any organic surface and can move through it at your normal speed. While merged:

- See and hear through the flesh within 60 feet

- Emerge from any point on the organic surface within 1 mile

- Immunity to all damage except psychic

- Cannot cast spells or take actions other than moving

If the spell ends while you're inside, you're shunted to the nearest open space and take 6d10 force damage.

allSpells.name: Flesh Memory
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a drop of blood or piece of tissue from a creature)
allSpells.description:
You touch flesh from a creature and experience a single memory from that creature's life. The memory is random unless you specify what type of memory you seek (their happiest moment, their greatest fear, etc.), in which case the spell provides the most relevant memory of that type.

Using this spell on tissue from a Sovereign or their direct servants requires a Wisdom save (DC 10 + the creature's CR, minimum 13) or the memory overwhelms you, leaving you stunned for 1 minute.

allSpells.name: Flesh Merge
allSpells.description:
You merge two willing creatures into one being temporarily. For the duration:

- The merged creature has the higher of each ability score from both

- It has HP equal to the combined HP of both creatures

- It can use abilities, features, and spells known by either creature

- It takes a single turn in initiative (use the higher modifier)

- Damage is split evenly between both creatures when they separate

When the spell ends, creatures appear in adjacent spaces and are disoriented (disadvantage on attacks until end of next turn).

allSpells.name: Flesh of the World
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a piece of divine tissue)
allSpells.description:
Your skin becomes like the world's flesh - tough, pale, and faintly iridescent. For the duration:

- You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

- You have advantage on saving throws against disease and poison

- You can move through solid flesh-based surfaces (organic matter, the Maker's terrain) as if they were difficult terrain

While merged with the world's flesh, you can see and hear through it within 30 feet. The world's flesh remembers - you may receive flashes of ancient events that occurred nearby.

allSpells.name: Flesh Read
allSpells.description:
You touch a creature and read their body's *history* rather than its current state. You experience flashes of significant physical events from their past:

- The worst injury they ever survived (you feel an echo of the pain)

- Whether they've ever died and been resurrected

- If their body has been altered by magic, divine power, or surgery

- Physical sensations associated with strong memories (a lover's touch, a parent's embrace, a torturer's work)

You don't learn context - only physical sensation. A scar tells you it was made by fire; it doesn't tell you who lit the flame or why. The spell can reveal that someone was tortured, but not by whom or what was asked.

Creatures can resist with a Constitution save if they're aware of the casting.

allSpells.name: Flesh Restoration
allSpells.components: V, S, M (organic matter worth 100 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You channel the world's regenerative power. A creature you touch gains one of the following benefits:

- Regains 6d8 + 10 hit points

- Has one limb regenerated (requires 1 minute of concentration)

- Is cured of all diseases, poisons, and one curse (not Sovereign curses)

- Has 10 years of aging reversed
allSpells.higherLevels: Healing increases by 2d8 for each slot level above 4th.

allSpells.name: Flesh Sense
allSpells.description:
You attune your senses to the living world. For the duration, you can sense the presence of living creatures within 30 feet, even through walls up to 1 foot thick. You know their general direction and whether they are wounded (below half HP).

You cannot sense undead, constructs, or creatures without organic bodies.

allSpells.name: Flesh Shaping
allSpells.components: V, S, M (organic matter matching the desired form)
allSpells.description:
You reshape a willing creature's body permanently. Choose one:

- **Alter Appearance:** Change physical features (height up to 1 foot, facial features, skin color, etc.). This is not an illusion - it's real flesh.

- **Adapt:** Grant water breathing, darkvision 60ft, or climbing speed equal to walking speed

- **Enhance:** Increase one ability score by 2 (maximum 20)

- **Graft:** Add a functional additional limb or sensory organ

Only one Flesh Shaping can affect a creature at a time. A new casting replaces the old.

allSpells.name: Flesh Symphony
allSpells.description:
You become a conductor of living flesh. For the duration, you have absolute control over organic matter within range:

- **Heal:** As a bonus action, restore 4d10 HP to any creature you can see

- **Harm:** As an action, deal 6d10 necrotic damage to a creature (Constitution save halves)

- **Shape:** As an action, reshape a willing creature's body (as Flesh Shaping, but temporary)

- **Bind:** As an action, fuse a creature to a surface or another creature (Strength save negates, escape DC equals your spell save DC)

- **Sense:** You automatically sense all creatures with organic bodies within range

You can use multiple effects on the same turn by using different action types.

**Special:** You can keep a creature alive regardless of their wounds while concentrating - they cannot die from HP loss while in range.

allSpells.name: Flesh Titan
allSpells.components: V, S, M (organic matter weighing at least 1,000 pounds)
allSpells.description:
You don't create a titan - you become the core of one. You merge with 1,000+ pounds of organic matter, your consciousness expanding to fill a massive flesh construct.

**The Titan Form:**

- Use Hill Giant statistics, but your mental ability scores, proficiencies, and class features remain

- You can cast spells that don't require material components (your hands are now titan-hands)

- Immunity to poison, psychic damage, charm, fear, paralysis, and petrification

- You perceive through the titan's senses; your original body is protected at the titan's core

**The Merger:** While merged, you feel everything the titan feels - damage registers as pain, movement feels sluggish and powerful. You cannot be targeted separately from the titan; effects that target "you" target the whole.

**Ending the Spell:** When the spell ends or the titan reaches 0 HP, you are expelled from the mass into the nearest unoccupied space. You take 4d10 psychic damage from the shock of compression.

allSpells.name: Flesh to Stone
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of lime, water, and earth)
allSpells.description:
You attempt to turn one creature that you can see within range into stone. If the target's body is made of flesh, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is restrained as its flesh begins to harden. On a successful save, the creature isn't affected.

A creature restrained by this spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails saves three times, it is turned to stone and subjected to the petrified condition for the duration. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive.

If the creature is physically broken while petrified, it suffers from similar deformities if it reverts to its original state. If you maintain your concentration on this spell for the entire possible duration, the creature is turned to stone until the effect is removed.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Near the Ossuary Kingdom, victims often transform into bone-like calcite rather than traditional stone.

allSpells.name: Fly
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a wing feather from any bird)
allSpells.description: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Use an Ash-Moth wing or Bloom Bat wing in place of the bird feather.

allSpells.name: Fog Cloud
allSpells.description: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Forbiddance (Ritual)
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a sprinkling of holy water, rare incense, and powdered ruby worth at least 1,000 gp)
allSpells.description:
You create a ward against magical travel that protects up to 40,000 square feet of floor space to a height of 30 feet above the floor. For the duration, creatures can't teleport into the area or use portals to enter the area. The spell proofs the area against planar travel.

In addition, the spell damages types of creatures that you choose when you cast it. Choose one or more of the following: celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. When a chosen creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature takes 5d10 radiant or necrotic damage (your choice when you cast this spell).

When you cast this spell, you can designate a password. A creature that speaks the password as it enters the area takes no damage from the spell.

If you cast forbiddance every day for 30 days in the same location, the spell lasts until it is dispelled, and the material components are consumed on the last casting.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Sanctified Blood, Devotional Incense from Veinspire, and powdered Heart-Stone can substitute.

allSpells.name: Forbidden Knowledge
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a page from a banned book)
allSpells.description:
You implant knowledge that the mind was never meant to hold. Choose a creature - they must make an Intelligence saving throw.

On failure, choose one:

- **Cosmic Truth:** They perceive reality's true nature. They are stunned for 1 minute (save ends each turn), and permanently lose 2 points of Wisdom as their worldview shatters

- **Future Death:** They witness their own death in perfect detail. They are frightened of the source of their death for 24 hours and have disadvantage on saves against that creature/effect

- **The Lie:** They learn that someone they trust has betrayed them (true or not - you choose what they believe). They are compelled to act on this information

- **Overload:** Their mind fills with useless information. They lose all prepared spells/spell slots until they complete a long rest

**Sovereign Attention:** Ismara considers unwanted knowledge a gift.

allSpells.name: Forcecage
allSpells.components: V, S, M (ruby dust worth 1,500 gp)
allSpells.description:
An immobile, invisible, cube-shaped prison composed of magical force springs into existence around an area you choose within range. The prison can be a cage or a solid box, as you choose.

A prison in the shape of a cage can be up to 20 feet on a side and is made from 1/2-inch diameter bars spaced 1/2 inch apart. A prison in the shape of a box can be up to 10 feet on a side, creating a solid barrier that prevents any matter from passing through it and blocking any spells cast into or out from the area.

When you cast the spell, any creature that is completely inside the cage's area is trapped. Creatures only partially within the area, or those too large to fit inside the area, are pushed away from the center of the area until they are completely outside the area.

A creature inside the cage can't leave it by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to leave the cage, it must first make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature can use that magic to exit the cage. On a failure, the creature can't exit the cage and wastes the use of the spell or effect.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Heart-Stone dust worth 1,500 gp can substitute for the ruby dust.

allSpells.name: Foresight
allSpells.description:
You touch a willing creature and bestow a limited ability to see into the immediate future. For the duration, the target can't be surprised and has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. Additionally, other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target for the duration.

This spell immediately ends if you cast it again before its duration ends.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A feather from one of the rare songbirds of the Pre-Sovereign era can substitute.

allSpells.name: Forget Me
allSpells.description:
You wrap yourself in borrowed insignificance. For the duration, you appear to be someone who belongs wherever you are - a servant in a castle, a merchant in a market, a traveler on a road. You don't choose the disguise; the spell reads the environment and makes you forgettable rather than invisible.

Creatures don't forget you - they simply never find you interesting enough to remember. You have advantage on Stealth and Deception checks to blend in. However, any aggressive action, loud speech, or unusual behavior immediately breaks the effect for all observers.

The spell fails entirely in locations where no one "belongs" - empty ruins, sealed tombs, or private chambers where any presence would be notable.

allSpells.name: Freedom of Movement
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a leather strap, bound around the arm or a similar appendage)
allSpells.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target's movement is unaffected by difficult terrain, and spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target's speed nor cause the target to be paralyzed or restrained.

The target can also spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape from nonmagical restraints, such as manacles or a creature that has it grappled. Finally, being underwater imposes no penalties on the target's movement or attacks.

allSpells.name: Frequency Jolt
allSpells.description: You send a disruptive vibration through a creature. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
allSpells.higherLevels: Damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Frequency Lock
allSpells.description:
You attune an object to a specific vibrational frequency that only you know. For the duration, the object cannot be moved, opened, or manipulated by anyone except you. Attempts to force it require a Strength check against your spell save DC + 10.

The object hums almost imperceptibly when touched by anyone other than you.

At Higher Levels: The duration increases to 24 hours at 4th level, 7 days at 5th level, and permanent at 6th level.

allSpells.name: Frequency Ping
allSpells.description:
You emit a pulse that returns information about material composition rather than shape. Choose a 10-foot cube within range - you learn what materials are present (stone, metal, wood, bone, flesh, etc.) and their approximate quantities. You can detect hidden compartments, false walls, or objects concealed within other objects.

This cantrip was developed to find Sovereign artifacts hidden within mundane containers. It cannot detect magical properties, only physical composition.

allSpells.name: Friends
allSpells.components: S, M (a small amount of makeup applied to the face as this spell is cast)
allSpells.description: For the duration, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at one creature of your choice that isn't hostile toward you. When the spell ends, the creature realizes that you used magic to influence its mood and becomes hostile toward you. A creature prone to violence might attack you. Another creature might seek retribution in other ways (at the DM's discretion), depending on the nature of your interaction with it.

allSpells.name: Frostbite
allSpells.description: You cause numbing frost to form on one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 cold damage, and it has disadvantage on the next weapon attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
allSpells.higherLevels: The spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

allSpells.name: Fungal Adaptation
allSpells.description:
Your body adapts with fungal resilience. For the duration:

- You gain resistance to poison damage and advantage on saves against poison

- You can breathe spores as easily as air (immunity to harmful spore effects)

- You can survive without eating by absorbing nutrients through your skin

- In dim light or darkness, you regenerate 1 HP at the start of each of your turns (doesn't function in bright light)

When the spell ends, you shed a fine layer of spores. These spores can be tracked by scent for 24 hours.

allSpells.name: Gaseous Form
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of gauze and a wisp of smoke)
allSpells.description:
You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points. An incorporeal creature isn't affected.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when stunned or otherwise incapacitated.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. The target can't attack or cast spells.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A wisp of Spore-Smoke from a puffball fungus can substitute for normal smoke.

allSpells.name: Gate
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 5,000 gp)
allSpells.description:
You conjure a portal linking an unoccupied space you can see within range to a precise location on a different plane of existence. The portal is a circular opening, which you can make 5 to 20 feet in diameter. You can orient the portal in any direction you choose. The portal lasts for the duration.

The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is instantly transported to the other plane, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal.

Deities and other planar rulers can prevent portals created by this spell from opening in their presence or anywhere within their domains.

When you cast this spell, you can speak the name of a specific creature (a pseudonym, title, or nickname doesn't work). If that creature is on a plane other than the one you are on, the portal opens in the named creature's immediate vicinity and draws the creature through it to the nearest unoccupied space on your side of the portal.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Heart-Stone worth 5,000 gp can substitute for the diamond. The Thirteen Sovereigns can block gates into their domains.

allSpells.name: Gentle Repose
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of salt and one copper piece placed on each of the corpse's eyes, which must remain there for the duration)
allSpells.description:
You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration, the target is protected from decay and cannot become undead.

The spell also effectively extends the time limit on raising the target from the dead, since days spent under the influence of this spell do not count against the time limit of spells such as raise dead.

allSpells.name: Giant Insect
allSpells.description:
You transform up to ten centipedes, three spiders, five wasps, or one scorpion within range into giant versions of their natural forms for the duration. A centipede becomes a giant centipede, a spider becomes a giant spider, a wasp becomes a giant wasp, and a scorpion becomes a giant scorpion.

Each creature obeys your verbal commands, and in combat, they act on your turn each round. The DM has the statistics for these creatures and resolves their actions and movement.

A creature remains in its giant size for the duration, until it drops to 0 hit points, or until you use an action to dismiss the effect on it.

The DM might allow you to choose different targets. For example, if you transform a bee, its giant version might have the same statistics as a giant wasp.
allSpells.ashenRealms: The Blooming Rot teems with oversized insects already. This spell can affect the unique species found there, creating even more monstrous versions.

allSpells.name: Glibness
allSpells.description: Until the spell ends, when you make a Charisma check, you can replace the number you roll with a 15. Additionally, no matter what you say, magic that would determine if you are telling the truth indicates that you are being truthful.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This spell is favored by the diplomats and spies who navigate the politics between the Thirteen Sovereigns.

allSpells.name: Globe of Invulnerability
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a glass or crystal bead that shatters when the spell ends)
allSpells.description:
An immobile, faintly shimmering barrier springs into existence in a 10-foot radius around you and remains for the duration.

Any spell of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the barrier blocks spells of one level higher for each slot level above 6th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: An Arterial Glass bead can substitute for the crystal component.

allSpells.name: Glyph of Warding
allSpells.components: V, S, M (incense and powdered diamond worth at least 200 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description: When you cast this spell, you inscribe a glyph that harms other creatures, either upon a surface (such as a table or a section of floor or wall) or within an object that can be closed (such as a book, a scroll, or a treasure chest) to conceal the glyph. If you choose a surface, the glyph can cover an area of the surface no larger than 10 feet in diameter. If you choose an object, that object must remain in its place; if the object is moved more than 10 feet from where you cast this spell, the glyph is broken, and the spell ends without being triggered.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of an explosive runes glyph increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Devotional Incense and crushed Heart-Stone (200 gp) can substitute for the standard components.

allSpells.name: Goodberry
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a sprig of mistletoe)
allSpells.description:
Up to ten berries appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. A creature can use its action to eat one berry. Eating a berry restores 1 hit point, and the berry provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.

The berries lose their potency if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of the casting of this spell.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Use Spore Pods or similar fungal growths from the Ashen Realms in place of mistletoe. The resulting berries manifest as small, luminescent fungi.

allSpells.name: Grasping Vine
allSpells.description:
You conjure a vine that sprouts from the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. When you cast this spell, you can direct the vine to lash out at a creature within 30 feet of it that you can see. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pulled 20 feet directly toward the vine.

Until the spell ends, you can direct the vine to lash out at the same creature or another one as a bonus action on each of your turns.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Blooming Rot, this spell often manifests as fungal tendrils rather than plant vines.

allSpells.name: Gravity Anchor
allSpells.description:
You attune a creature or object to a specific gravitational source other than the ground. Choose a target within range and designate a new "down" for them - a wall, ceiling, specific creature, or even a thrown object.

For the duration, gravity pulls the target toward their anchor at normal strength. A creature anchored to a wall walks on it normally. A creature anchored to an enemy is pulled toward them at the start of each turn (10 feet, or until contact). An object anchored to a moving creature follows them.

If the anchor is destroyed or moves beyond 120 feet, the spell ends and normal gravity resumes - potentially causing a long fall.
allSpells.higherLevels: At 4th level, you can anchor up to three creatures or objects to the same source.

allSpells.name: Gravity Storm
allSpells.description:
You channel the Choirless Monarch's dominion over resonance and weight. A sphere of chaotic gravity 60 feet in radius appears at a point you can see. Within:

- Start of each creature's turn, roll 1d6:

- 1-2: Gravity triples (half movement, disadvantage on attacks)

- 3-4: Gravity reverses (fall upward 60 feet)

- 5-6: Gravity nullifies (float, move in any direction at half speed)

- Creatures take 4d10 bludgeoning when gravity shifts

- Ranged attacks through the sphere have disadvantage

You are immune to the sphere's effects.

**Sovereign Attention:** Eredain feels every distortion of weight as a discordant note in reality.

allSpells.name: Gravity Well
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a tuning fork that has shattered from overuse)
allSpells.description:
You invoke the Choirless Monarch's absolute command over weight, creating a crushing point of collapsed gravity. All creatures within 100 feet of the point are pulled toward it:

- Within 20 feet: Restrained, 6d10 bludgeoning each round

- Within 60 feet: Strength save or pulled 30 feet toward center

- Within 100 feet: Half speed away from center

Flying creatures automatically fall toward center. Structures within 60 feet take 10d10 damage each round.

**Sovereign Attention:** Eredain considers this spell a crude imitation of his power. He may choose to intensify or negate the effect at his whim.

allSpells.name: Grease
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of pork rind or butter)
allSpells.description:
Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into difficult terrain for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

allSpells.name: Greater Invisibility
allSpells.description: You or a creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person.

allSpells.name: Greater Restoration
allSpells.components: V, S, M (diamond dust worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

- One effect that charmed or petrified the target

- One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

- Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

- One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum
allSpells.ashenRealms: Crushed Heart-Stone (100 gp, consumed) can substitute for the diamond dust.

allSpells.name: Green-Flame Blade
allSpells.components: S, M (a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp)
allSpells.description: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can cause green fire to leap from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes fire damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.
allSpells.higherLevels: At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra 1d8 fire damage to the target on a hit, and the fire damage to the second creature increases to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 11th level (2d8 and 2d8) and 17th level (3d8 and 3d8).

allSpells.name: Guardian of Faith
allSpells.description:
A Large spectral guardian appears and hovers for the duration in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The guardian occupies that space and is indistinct except for a gleaming sword and shield emblazoned with the symbol of your deity.

Any creature hostile to you that moves to a space within 10 feet of the guardian for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 20 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The guardian vanishes when it has dealt a total of 60 damage.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, the guardian takes on the aspect of the caster's patron Sovereign rather than a traditional deity.

allSpells.name: Guardian of Nature
allSpells.description:
A nature spirit answers your call and transforms you into a powerful guardian. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. You choose one of the following forms to assume: Primal Beast or Great Tree.

**Primal Beast.** Bestial fur covers your body, your facial features become feral, and you gain the following benefits:

- Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

- You gain darkvision with a range of 120 feet.

- You make Strength-based attack rolls with advantage.

- Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 force damage on a hit.

**Great Tree.** Your skin appears barky, leaves sprout from your hair, and you gain the following benefits:

- You gain 10 temporary hit points.

- You make Constitution saving throws with advantage.

- You make Dexterity- and Wisdom-based attack rolls with advantage.

- While you are on the ground, the ground within 15 feet of you is difficult terrain for your enemies.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, Primal Beast often manifests with fungal or bone characteristics, while Great Tree may appear as twisted, pale growth covered in luminescent moss.

allSpells.name: Guards and Wards
allSpells.components: V, S, M (burning incense, a small measure of brimstone and oil, a knotted string, a small amount of umber hulk blood, and a small silver rod worth at least 10 gp)
allSpells.description:
You create a ward that protects up to 2,500 square feet of floor space. The warded area can be up to 20 feet tall, and shaped as you desire. You can ward several stories of a stronghold by dividing the area among them.

The spell creates the following effects within the warded area:

- **Corridors:** Fog fills all the warded corridors, making them heavily obscured. At each intersection, there is a 50 percent chance that a creature will believe it is going in the opposite direction.

- **Doors:** All doors in the warded area are magically locked as if sealed by an arcane lock spell.

- **Stairs:** Webs fill all stairs in the warded area from top to bottom, as the web spell.

- **Other Spell Effect:** You can place dancing lights in four corridors, magic mouth in two locations, stinking cloud in two locations, a constant gust of wind in one corridor or room, or a suggestion in one location.

Casting this spell every day for one year makes it permanent.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Ember-Salt, brimstone, Mycelium Thread, Cartilage Worm ichor, and a Marrow-Silver rod can substitute.

allSpells.name: Guidance
allSpells.description: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the ability check. The spell then ends.

allSpells.name: Guiding Bolt
allSpells.description: A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Gust
allSpells.description:
You seize the air and compel it to create one of the following effects at a point you can see within range:

- One Medium or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet away from you.

- You create a small blast of air capable of moving one object that is neither held nor carried and that weighs no more than 5 pounds. The object is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. It isn't pushed with enough force to cause damage.

- You create a harmless sensory effect using air, such as causing leaves to rustle, wind to slam shutters shut, or your clothing to ripple in a breeze.

allSpells.name: Gust of Wind
allSpells.description:
A line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the line.

Any creature in the line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the line blasts from you.

allSpells.name: Hail of Thorns
allSpells.description: The next time you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack before the spell ends, this spell creates a rain of thorns that sprouts from your ranged weapon or ammunition. In addition to the normal effect of the attack, the target of the attack and each creature within 5 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 1d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
allSpells.higherLevels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st (to a maximum of 6d10).

allSpells.name: Hallucinatory Terrain
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a stone, a twig, and a bit of green plant)
allSpells.description:
You make natural terrain in a 150-foot cube in range look, sound, and smell like some other sort of natural terrain. Thus, open fields or a road can be made to resemble a swamp, hill, crevasse, or some other difficult or impassable terrain. A pond can be made to seem like a grassy meadow, a precipice like a gentle slope, or a rock-strewn gully like a wide and smooth road. Manufactured structures, equipment, and creatures within the area aren't changed in appearance.

The tactile characteristics of the terrain are unchanged, so creatures entering the area are likely to see through the illusion. If the difference isn't obvious by touch, a creature carefully examining the illusion can attempt an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to disbelieve it. A creature who discerns the illusion for what it is, sees it as a vague image superimposed on the terrain.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Bone Ridge Stone, a Mycelium Thread strand, and a piece of Rot-Moss can substitute for the standard components.

allSpells.name: Harm
allSpells.description: You unleash a virulent disease on a creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 14d6 necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. The damage can't reduce the target's hit points below 1. If the target fails the saving throw, its hit point maximum is reduced for 1 hour by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it took.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This spell resonates with the entropic energies of the Devoured Courts.

allSpells.name: Harmonic Devastation
allSpells.description:
You release a devastating wave of resonant force. All creatures and structures within 100 feet must make Constitution saving throws.

**Creatures:** 10d6 thunder damage on failure, half on success. Creatures made of stone, metal, or crystal take maximum damage.

**Structures:** Take 50 thunder damage. Structures already damaged take 100 instead.

The wave leaves a visible ripple in reality that fades over 1 minute.

allSpells.name: Harmonic Shield
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction (when you are hit by an attack)
allSpells.description:
You vibrate at a frequency that stores kinetic energy rather than dispersing it. You take the damage normally, but the energy is captured in a resonant field around you.

Until the end of your next turn, the first melee attack you make releases the stored energy - it deals additional thunder damage equal to the damage you absorbed (maximum 20). If you don't attack before the field dissipates, the energy releases harmlessly as a low hum.
allSpells.higherLevels: The maximum stored damage increases by 10 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Harmonic Step
allSpells.description:
You match your vibrational frequency to a sound you can hear. Until the end of your next turn, whenever that sound occurs within 60 feet, you can use your reaction to instantly appear at its source.

Common uses include attuning to an ally's voice (appear when they call for help), an enemy's weapon (appear when they draw steel), or environmental sounds (appear wherever footsteps fall). You can only attune to one sound at a time, and you must be able to identify the sound when you hear it.
allSpells.higherLevels: At 4th level, you can attune to two different sounds simultaneously.

allSpells.name: Haste
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a shaving of licorice root)
allSpells.description:
Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

When the spell ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

allSpells.name: Heal
allSpells.description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. A surge of positive energy washes through the creature, causing it to regain 70 hit points. The spell also ends blindness, deafness, and any diseases affecting the target. This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the amount of healing increases by 10 for each slot level above 6th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In Veinspire, this spell manifests as warm crimson light drawn from the domain's lifeblood.

allSpells.name: Healing Word
allSpells.description: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Heartfire Infusion
allSpells.components: V, S, M (Ember-Salt worth 100 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You infuse a willing creature with passion-fire. For the duration:

- Immunity to fire damage and resistance to cold damage

- +1d6 fire damage with weapon attacks

- Bright light in 20 feet, dim light for another 20 feet

- Advantage on Charisma checks and saves

When the spell ends, the target must make a Constitution save against your spell save DC or gain one level of exhaustion as the fire burns out.

allSpells.name: Heat Metal
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a piece of iron and a flame)
allSpells.description:
Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 fire damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it does not drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Hellish Rebuke
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction, which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see
allSpells.description: You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Heroes' Feast
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a gem-encrusted bowl worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
You bring forth a great feast, including magnificent food and drink. The feast takes 1 hour to consume and disappears at the end of that time, and the beneficial effects don't set in until this hour is over. Up to twelve other creatures can partake of the feast.

A creature that partakes of the feast gains several benefits. The creature is cured of all diseases and poison, becomes immune to poison and being frightened, and makes all Wisdom saving throws with advantage. Its hit point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of hit points. These benefits last for 24 hours.
