You fill a 20-foot cube you can see within range with fey and draconic magic. Roll on the Mischievous Surge table to determine the magical effect produced, and roll again at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. You can move the cube up to 10 feet before you roll.

**Mischievous Surge Table:**

| d4 | Effect |

|---|---|

| 1 | The smell of apple pie fills the air, and each creature in the cube must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by you until the start of your next turn. |

| 2 | Bouquets of flowers appear all around, and each creature in the cube must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the start of your next turn as the flowers spray water in their faces. |

| 3 | Each creature in the cube must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or begin giggling until the start of your next turn. A giggling creature is incapacitated and uses all its movement to move in a random direction. |

| 4 | Drops of molasses hover in the cube, making it difficult terrain until the start of your next turn. |

allSpells.name: Nightmare Bleed
allSpells.description:
You cause a creature's worst nightmares to manifest partially in reality. The target makes a Wisdom save. On failure, shadowy nightmare-creatures emerge from their shadow and attack:

- 2 nightmare creatures appear (use Shadow stat block, but they're not undead)

- The nightmares are only visible and tangible to the target and you

- Other creatures can't help fight them, can't perceive them, and can't understand why the target is fighting empty air

- If the target is reduced to 0 HP by the nightmares, they don't die - they wake up screaming with 1 HP, incapacitated until the end of their next turn

The nightmares pursue the target relentlessly. You can communicate with the nightmares telepathically.

**Sovereign Attention:** Nhalyra watches every nightmare with something like fondness.

allSpells.name: Nondetection
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of diamond dust worth 25 gp sprinkled over the target, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description: For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from divination magic. The target can be a willing creature or a place or an object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. The target can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

allSpells.name: Null Step
allSpells.description:
You step into a space that doesn't exist yet. Choose an unoccupied 5-foot space within 30 feet - you don't teleport there, you simply *were always there*. Your original position becomes uncertain; creatures who were looking at you must make a Wisdom saving throw or believe you were standing in your new position the entire time.

This retroactive positioning means you weren't where attacks targeted you. If you cast this spell after being targeted but before damage is rolled, the attack misses (you weren't there to be hit).
allSpells.higherLevels: At 3rd level, you can bring one willing creature with you. At 5th level, creatures who fail their save also forget seeing you at your original position entirely.

allSpells.name: Null Wound
allSpells.description:
You create a wound of nothingness - a brief tear in existence. A creature you can see must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

A creature reduced to 0 HP by this spell doesn't leave a corpse. Their body dissolves into void-static over 6 seconds, leaving only equipment behind. Resurrection requires True Resurrection or Wish.
allSpells.higherLevels: Damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

allSpells.name: Nullfield Touch
allSpells.description:
You touch an object and temporarily suppress its magical properties. For the duration, one magic item you touch (weighing no more than 10 pounds) loses its magical properties - a glowing sword stops glowing, a ring of protection provides no bonus, a sending stone can't send.

This cantrip was developed by Free City artificers to safely handle confiscated Sovereign artifacts. It has no effect on artifacts or items created by Sovereigns directly - their power is too deeply woven.

allSpells.name: Nystul's Magic Aura
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a small square of silk)
allSpells.description:
You place an illusion on a creature or an object you touch so that divination spells reveal false information about it. The target can be a willing creature or an object that is not being carried or worn by another creature.

When you cast the spell, choose one or both of the following effects. The effect lasts for the duration. If you cast this spell on the same creature or object every day for 30 days, placing the same effect on it each time, the illusion lasts until it is dispelled.

**False Aura.** You change the way the target appears to spells and magical effects, such as detect magic, that detect magical auras. You can make a nonmagical object appear magical, a magical object appear nonmagical, or change the object's magical aura so that it appears to belong to a specific school of magic that you choose. When you use this effect on an object, you can make the false magic apparent to any creature that handles the item.

**Mask.** You change the way the target appears to spells and magical effects that detect creature types, such as a paladin's Divine Sense or the trigger of a symbol spell. You choose a creature type and other spells and magical effects treat the target as if it were a creature of that type or of that alignment.

allSpells.name: Obscuring Presence
allSpells.components: V, S, M (powdered silver worth 25 gp)
allSpells.description:
You create a field of divine static around yourself. You and all creatures you choose within 10 feet cannot be targeted or perceived by divination magic, including scrying, detect thoughts, and locate creature.

Additionally, Sovereign servants have difficulty focusing on you - they have disadvantage on Perception checks to notice you.

This spell was developed by Free City wardcasters specifically to hide from the Thirteen.

allSpells.name: Obsessive Fixation
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a lock of hair from someone driven mad by curiosity)
allSpells.description:
You implant an all-consuming obsession in a creature's mind. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure, you choose their obsession:

- **A creature:** They must move toward that creature on their turn and can only attack that creature

- **An object:** They must try to reach and possess that object, ignoring other threats

- **A question:** They spend their turn trying to puzzle out the answer, taking no other actions

- **An exit:** They must flee by the most direct route

The target can repeat the save at the end of each turn. While obsessed, they have disadvantage on saves against other effects.

**Sovereign Attention:** Ismara finds obsession beautiful - it's knowledge pursuing itself.

allSpells.name: Ossuary Kingdom
allSpells.components: V, S, M (bones from 1,000 dead creatures, 25,000 gp worth of black diamonds)
allSpells.description:
You invoke the Bone-Warden's authority to create a lesser reflection of his domain. Within 1 mile:

- All dead creatures rise as undead under your control

- Living creatures have disadvantage on death saves

- Healing magic is halved

- Necrotic damage heals undead instead of damaging them

- Cast any necromancy spell of 5th level or lower without expending spell slots

When the spell ends, all undead created crumble to dust.

**Sovereign Attention:** Vortegas takes immediate notice. He may claim any undead raised as his own, or demand tribute for the use of his domain's power.

allSpells.name: Ossuary Rising
allSpells.components: V, S, M (bones from 100 different creatures, 2,500 gp worth of precious metals)
allSpells.description:
You raise an army from the bones of the world. Up to 20 skeletons or 10 skeleton warriors (Veteran statistics with necrotic resistance) rise from the ground.

The undead obey your commands for the duration. They can perform complex tasks, speak, and retain whatever skills their bones remember.

**At 9th Level:** 40 skeletons or 20 skeleton warriors, plus 1 Bone Golem (Clay Golem stats with necrotic immunity).

allSpells.name: Ossuary Sanctum
allSpells.components: V, S, M (bone dust worth 500 gp)
allSpells.description:
You call upon the Bone-Warden's domain to create a sanctum of bone - a dome 30 feet in diameter made of interlocking skeletal remains. AC 18, 100 HP, immunity to poison, psychic, and necrotic damage.

Inside the sanctum:

- Undead have advantage on saving throws

- Necromancy spells are cast at one slot level higher (no additional cost)

- Living creatures have disadvantage on death saves

- Divination from outside cannot perceive inside

The bones whisper occasionally. They're not saying anything coherent. Probably.

**Sovereign Attention:** Vortegas is dimly aware of every sanctum created in his name. Extended use may attract his servants.

allSpells.name: Otiluke's Freezing Sphere
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a small crystal sphere)
allSpells.description:
A frigid globe of cold energy streaks from your fingertips to a point of your choice within range, where it explodes in a 60-foot-radius sphere. Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d6 cold damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

If the globe strikes a body of water or a liquid that is principally water, it freezes the liquid to a depth of 6 inches over an area 30 feet square. This ice lasts for 1 minute.

You can refrain from firing the globe after completing the spell, if you wish. A small globe about the size of a sling stone, cool to the touch, appears in your hand.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 6th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: An Arterial Glass sphere can substitute for the crystal sphere.

allSpells.name: Otiluke's Resilient Sphere
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a hemispherical piece of clear crystal and a matching hemispherical piece of gum arabic)
allSpells.description:
A sphere of shimmering force encloses a creature or object of Large size or smaller within range. An unwilling creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is enclosed for the duration.

Nothing — not physical objects, energy, or other spell effects — can pass through the barrier, in or out, though a creature in the sphere can breathe there. The sphere is immune to all damage, and a creature or object inside can't be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, nor can a creature inside the sphere damage anything outside it.

The sphere is weightless and just large enough to contain the creature or object inside. An enclosed creature can use its action to push against the sphere's walls and thus roll the sphere at up to half the creature's speed. Similarly, the globe can be picked up and moved by other creatures.

A disintegrate spell targeting the globe destroys it without harming anything inside it.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Arterial Glass hemispheres can substitute for the crystal and gum arabic components.

allSpells.name: Otto's Irresistible Dance
allSpells.description:
Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target begins a comic dance in place: shuffling, tapping its feet, and capering for the duration. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this spell.

A dancing creature must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls. While the target is affected by this spell, other creatures have advantage on attack rolls against it. As an action, a dancing creature makes a Wisdom saving throw to regain control of itself. On a successful save, the spell ends.

allSpells.name: Paradox Engine
allSpells.components: V, S, M (two objects that cannot logically coexist)
allSpells.description:
You become a living paradox. For the duration:

- You exist in two locations simultaneously (within 60 feet of each other)

- Both versions can take full actions (you choose which version takes each action)

- Damage to one version is halved; damage to both is full

- Once per turn, swap which version is "real" (the other becomes illusory until next swap)

- Spells you cast can originate from either location

When the spell ends, choose which location you appear in. The other version fades.

**Cost:** When the spell ends, roll a d20. On a 1, you take 10d10 psychic damage as the paradox resolves violently.

allSpells.name: Paradox Shield
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction (when you are targeted by an attack or spell)
allSpells.description:
You briefly exist in a state of contradiction - both hit and unhit. Roll a d20:

- 1-10: You take the damage/effect normally

- 11-20: The attack or spell has no effect on you

You cannot choose the outcome.

**Sovereign Attention:** Karthayne appreciates those who embrace uncertainty.

allSpells.name: Pass without Trace
allSpells.components: V, S, M (ashes from a burned leaf of mistletoe and a sprig of spruce)
allSpells.description: A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks and cannot be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.
allSpells.ashenRealms: The ashes and spruce can be replaced with powdered Shadow-Moss.

allSpells.name: Passion Eruption
allSpells.components: V, S, M (Ember-Salt worth 1,000 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
Passion-flames erupt from a point you can see in a 40-foot-radius sphere.

All creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failure: 12d6 fire damage and ignited (4d6 fire damage at start of each turn until action spent to extinguish). On success: half damage, not ignited.

Creatures who fail by 5 or more are also affected by their strongest emotion (as Passion's Prisoner) for 1 minute.

allSpells.name: Passion Flare
allSpells.description:
You release a burst of passion-fire - flames fueled by emotion rather than fuel. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

If you are currently experiencing a strong emotion (rage, grief, love, terror), the damage increases to 4d6.
allSpells.higherLevels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Passion's Prisoner
allSpells.description:
You trap a creature in their own passion. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure, they become consumed by their strongest emotion:

- **Rage:** Attack the nearest creature (ally or enemy) each turn

- **Fear:** Use all movement to flee, take no actions

- **Love:** Charmed by the object of affection, refuse to harm them

- **Grief:** Incapacitated, weeping

- **Joy:** Incapacitated, laughing

The target can repeat the save at the end of each turn. On success, the spell ends but the emotion lingers at normal intensity.

allSpells.name: Passwall
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of sesame seeds)
allSpells.description:
A passage appears at a point of your choice that you can see on a wooden, plaster, or stone surface (such as a wall, a ceiling, or a floor) within range, and lasts for the duration. You choose the opening's dimensions: up to 5 feet wide, 8 feet tall, and 20 feet deep. The passage creates no instability in a structure surrounding it.

When the opening disappears, any creatures or objects still in the passage created by the spell are safely ejected to an unoccupied space nearest to the surface on which you cast the spell.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Spore Powder can substitute for sesame seeds.

allSpells.name: Perfecting Agony
allSpells.description:
You embrace pain as a path to perfection. For the duration:

- When you take damage, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls (stacking up to +5)

- You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed

- Your weapon attacks score critical hits on 19-20

**Cost:** When the spell ends, you take psychic damage equal to the total bonus accumulated (if you reached +5, you take 5 psychic damage).

allSpells.name: Phantasmal Force
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece)
allSpells.description:
You craft an illusion that takes root in the mind of a creature that you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you create a phantasmal object, creature, or other visible phenomenon of your choice that is no larger than a 10-foot cube and that is perceivable only to the target for the duration.

The phantasm includes sound, temperature, and other stimuli, also evident only to the creature. The target can use its action to examine the phantasm with an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If the check succeeds, the target realizes that the phantasm is an illusion, and the spell ends.

While a target is affected by the spell, the target treats the phantasm as if it were real. The target rationalizes any illogical outcomes from interacting with the phantasm.

An affected target is so convinced of the phantasm's reality that it can even take damage from the illusion. Each round on your turn, the phantasm can deal 1d6 psychic damage to the target if it is in the phantasm's area or within 5 feet of the phantasm.

allSpells.name: Phantasmal Killer
allSpells.description: You tap into the nightmares of a creature you can see within range and create an illusory manifestation of its deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes frightened for the duration. At the end of each of the target's turns before the spell ends, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 4d10 psychic damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 4th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, this spell often manifests fears related to the Sovereigns — visions of the Hollow Crown's empty gaze, the Crimson Matron's hunger, or the Verdant King's consuming growth.

allSpells.name: Phantom Congregation
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a clay figurine worth 100 gp)
allSpells.description:
You create a convincing magical decoy of yourself and up to 5 willing creatures within range. The decoys appear at locations you designate within 1 mile, and they:

- Appear completely real, including sound, smell, and thermal signature

- Can perform simple scripted actions (walking a patrol route, sitting at a table, sleeping)

- Register to divination magic as the real creatures

- Dissipate if touched or attacked (appearing to flee or "escape")

Meanwhile, you and the original creatures become invisible to divination magic and Sovereign perception for the duration. Sovereigns and their servants who try to scry on you find the decoy instead.

This spell is a favorite of Free City diplomats and resistance cells operating in Sovereign territories.

allSpells.name: Phantom Steed
allSpells.description:
A Large quasi-real, horselike creature appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature's appearance, but it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The creature uses the statistics for a riding horse, except it has a speed of 100 feet and can travel 10 miles in an hour, or 13 miles at a fast pace. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends if you use an action to dismiss it or if the steed takes any damage.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, the phantom steed often takes the form of a spectral Giant Cave Beetle or other subterranean creature.

allSpells.name: Planar Ally
allSpells.description:
You beseech an otherworldly entity for aid. The being must be known to you: a god, a primordial, a demon prince, or some other being of cosmic power. That entity sends a celestial, an elemental, or a fiend loyal to it to aid you, making the creature appear in an unoccupied space within range.

When the creature appears, it is under no compulsion to behave in any particular way. You can ask the creature to perform a service in exchange for payment, but it isn't obliged to do so.

Payment can take a variety of forms. A celestial might require a sizable donation of gold or magic items to an allied temple, while a fiend might demand a living sacrifice or a gift of treasure. As a rule of thumb, a task measured in minutes requires a payment worth 100 gp per minute, hours require 1,000 gp per hour, and days (up to 10 days) require 10,000 gp per day.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, this spell typically beseeches one of the Thirteen Sovereigns, who send servants appropriate to their domain.

allSpells.name: Planar Binding
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a jewel worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
With this spell, you attempt to bind a celestial, an elemental, a fey, or a fiend to your service. The creature must be within range for the entire casting of the spell. (Typically, the creature is first summoned into the center of an inverted magic circle in order to keep it trapped while this spell is cast.) At the completion of the casting, the target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it is bound to serve you for the duration. If the creature was summoned or created by another spell, that spell's duration is extended to match the duration of this spell.

A bound creature must follow your instructions to the best of its ability. You might command the creature to accompany you on an adventure, to guard a location, or to deliver a message. The creature obeys the letter of your instructions, but if the creature is hostile to you, it strives to twist your words to achieve its own objectives. If the creature carries out your instructions completely before the spell ends, it travels to you to report this fact if you are on the same plane of existence. If you are on a different plane of existence, it returns to the place where you bound it and remains there until the spell ends.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of a higher level, the duration increases to: 10 days with a 6th-level slot, 30 days with a 7th-level slot, 180 days with an 8th-level slot, 1 year and 1 day with a 9th-level spell slot.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A Heart-Stone from Veinspire worth at least 1,000 gp can serve as the binding focus, its crystallized life essence creating a sympathetic link to bind extraplanar entities.

allSpells.name: Plane Shift
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a forked, metal rod worth at least 250 gp, attuned to a particular plane of existence)
allSpells.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

You can use this spell to banish an unwilling creature to another plane. Choose a creature within your reach and make a melee spell attack against it. On a hit, the creature must make a Charisma saving throw. If the creature fails the save, it is transported to a random location on the plane of existence you specify. A creature so transported must find its own way back to your current plane of existence.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Rods attuned to the domains of the Thirteen Sovereigns are rare and highly sought after by planar travelers.

allSpells.name: Plant Growth
allSpells.description:
This spell channels vitality into plants within a specific area. There are two possible uses for the spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you enrich the land. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 1 year. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, this spell affects fungal growths and mycelial networks rather than traditional plants, causing mushrooms and fungal matter to proliferate rapidly.

allSpells.name: Poison Spray
allSpells.description: You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d12 poison damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: This spell's damage increases by 1d12 when you reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

allSpells.name: Polymorph
allSpells.description:
This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. A shapechanger automatically succeeds on this saving throw.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be any beast whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious.

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. This spell can't affect a target that has 0 hit points.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Transformation Sap from the Blooming Rot can substitute for the caterpillar cocoon.

allSpells.name: Potential Collapse
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction (when a creature within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw)
allSpells.description:
You collapse quantum possibilities. The triggering creature must reroll and use the lower result.

**Cost:** You take 1d6 psychic damage as contradictory possibilities echo through your mind.

**Sovereign Attention:** Karthayne delights in uncertainty made manifest.

allSpells.name: Power Word Heal
allSpells.description: A wave of healing energy washes over the creature you touch. The target regains all its hit points. If the creature is charmed, frightened, paralyzed, or stunned, the condition ends. If the creature is prone, it can use its reaction to stand up. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This word of power carries the authority of life itself, resonating with the Crimson Matron's domain.

allSpells.name: Power Word Kill
allSpells.description: You utter a word of power that can compel one creature you can see within range to die instantly. If the creature you chose has 100 hit points or fewer, it dies. Otherwise, the spell has no effect.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This word resonates with the finality of the Hollow Crown's domain.

allSpells.name: Power Word Pain
allSpells.description:
You speak a word of power that causes waves of intense pain to assail one creature you can see within range. If the target has 100 hit points or fewer, it is subject to crippling pain. Otherwise, the spell has no effect on it. A target is also unaffected if it is immune to being charmed.

While the target is affected by crippling pain, any speed it has can be no higher than 10 feet. The target also has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, other than Constitution saving throws. Finally, if the target tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the casting fails and the spell is wasted.

A target suffering this pain can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the pain ends.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This word resonates with the suffering echoes of the Devoured Courts.

allSpells.name: Power Word Stun
allSpells.description:
You speak a word of power that can overwhelm the mind of one creature you can see within range, leaving it dumbfounded. If the target has 150 hit points or fewer, it is stunned. Otherwise, the spell has no effect.

The stunned target must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, this stunning effect ends.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This word of power resonates with the authority of the Thirteen Sovereigns.

allSpells.name: Prayer of Healing
allSpells.description: Up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range each regain hit points equal to 2d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Prestidigitation
allSpells.description:
This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

- You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

- You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

- You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

- You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

- You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

- You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

allSpells.name: Primal Savagery
allSpells.description: You channel primal magic to cause your teeth or fingernails to sharpen, ready to deliver a corrosive attack. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 acid damage. After you make the attack, your teeth or fingernails return to normal.
allSpells.higherLevels: The spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

allSpells.name: Primordial Ward
allSpells.description: You have resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage for the spell's duration. When you take damage of one of those types, you can use your reaction to gain immunity to that type of damage, including against the triggering damage. If you do so, the resistances end, and you have the immunity until the end of your next turn, at which time the spell ends.

allSpells.name: Prismatic Spray
allSpells.description:
Eight multicolored rays of light flash from your hand. Each ray is a different color and has a different power and purpose. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. For each target, roll a d8 to determine which color ray affects it.

1. **Red.** The target takes 10d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

2. **Orange.** The target takes 10d6 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

3. **Yellow.** The target takes 10d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

4. **Green.** The target takes 10d6 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

5. **Blue.** The target takes 10d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

6. **Indigo.** On a failed save, the target is restrained. It must then make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the spell ends. If it fails its save three times, it permanently turns to stone and is subjected to the petrified condition.

7. **Violet.** On a failed save, the target is blinded. It must then make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of your next turn. A successful save ends the blindness. If it fails that save, the creature is transported to another plane of existence of the DM's choosing and is no longer blinded.

8. **Special.** The target is struck by two rays. Roll twice more, rerolling any 8.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Near the Bastion of Fireblood, the red ray burns with particular intensity; near the Ossuary Kingdom, the indigo ray's petrification takes on a bone-like quality.

allSpells.name: Prismatic Wall
allSpells.description:
A shimmering, multicolored plane of light forms a vertical opaque wall—up to 90 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 inch thick—centered on a point you can see within range. Alternatively, you can shape the wall into a sphere up to 30 feet in diameter centered on a point you choose within range.

The wall sheds bright light out to a range of 100 feet and dim light for an additional 100 feet. You and creatures you designate at the time you cast the spell can pass through and remain near the wall without harm.

The wall consists of seven layers, each with a different color. When a creature attempts to reach into or pass through the wall, it does so one layer at a time through all the wall's layers:

1. **Red:** 10d6 fire damage. Destroyed by 25 cold damage.

2. **Orange:** 10d6 acid damage. Destroyed by strong wind.

3. **Yellow:** 10d6 lightning damage. Destroyed by 60 force damage.

4. **Green:** 10d6 poison damage. Destroyed by passwall or similar spell.

5. **Blue:** 10d6 cold damage. Destroyed by 25 fire damage.

6. **Indigo:** Restrained, then petrified after three failed saves. Destroyed by daylight spell.

7. **Violet:** Blinded, then banished to another plane after failed Wisdom save. Destroyed by dispel magic.
allSpells.ashenRealms: The colors often shift to reflect the local Sovereign's domain.

allSpells.name: Probability Storm
allSpells.description:
You create a 30-foot radius sphere of quantum uncertainty at a point you can see. Within the sphere:

- All attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws require rolling twice and using the result closest to 10 (neither high nor low extremes)

- Critical hits and critical failures are impossible

- At the start of each creature's turn inside, roll 1d6:

- 1-2: They take 4d6 force damage

- 3-4: They are healed for 4d6 HP

- 5-6: They are teleported to a random unoccupied space within the sphere

**Sovereign Attention:** Karthayne watches every instance of probability manipulation with delight.

allSpells.name: Produce Flame
allSpells.description:
A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.

You can also attack with the flame, although doing so ends the spell. When you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the flame at a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 fire damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

allSpells.name: Programmed Illusion
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece and jade dust worth at least 25 gp)
allSpells.description:
You create an illusion of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon within range that activates when a specific condition occurs. The illusion is imperceptible until then. It must be no larger than a 30-foot cube, and you decide when you cast the spell how the illusion behaves and what sounds it makes. This scripted performance can last up to 5 minutes.

When the condition you specify occurs, the illusion springs into existence and performs in the manner you described. Once the illusion finishes performing, it disappears and remains dormant for 10 minutes. After this time, the illusion can be activated again.

The triggering condition can be as general or as detailed as you like, though it must be based on visual or audible conditions that occur within 30 feet of the area.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Fleece and jade dust infused with Void-Dust can substitute.

allSpells.name: Project Image
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a small replica of you made from materials worth at least 5 gp)
allSpells.description:
You create an illusory copy of yourself that lasts for the duration. The copy can appear at any location within range that you have seen before, regardless of intervening obstacles. The illusion looks and sounds like you but is intangible. If the illusion takes any damage, it disappears, and the spell ends.

You can use your action to move this illusion up to twice your speed, and make it gesture, speak, and behave in whatever way you choose. It mimics your mannerisms perfectly.

You can see through its eyes and hear through its ears as if you were in its space. On your turn as a bonus action, you can switch from using its senses to using your own, or back again. While you are using its senses, you are blinded and deafened in regard to your own surroundings.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A small replica carved from Bone Ridge Stone worth 5 gp can substitute.

allSpells.name: Protection from Energy
allSpells.description: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has resistance to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

allSpells.name: Protection from Evil and Good
allSpells.components: V, S, M (holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also cannot be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

allSpells.name: Protection from Poison
allSpells.description:
You touch a creature. If it is poisoned, you neutralize the poison. If more than one poison afflicts the target, you neutralize one poison that you know is present, or you neutralize one at random.

For the duration, the target has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and it has resistance to poison damage.

allSpells.name: Psychic Scream
allSpells.description:
You unleash the power of your mind to blast the intellect of up to ten creatures of your choice that you can see within range. Creatures that have an Intelligence score of 2 or lower are unaffected.

Each target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 14d6 psychic damage and is stunned. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

A stunned target can make an Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the stunning effect ends.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This spell resonates with the maddening whispers of the Devoured Courts.

allSpells.name: Pulse Wave
allSpells.description:
You create intense pressure, unleash it in a 30-foot cone, and decide whether the pressure pulls or pushes creatures and objects. Each creature in that cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 6d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. And every creature that fails the save is either pulled 15 feet toward you or pushed 15 feet away from you, depending on the choice you made for the spell.

In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the cone are likewise pulled or pushed 15 feet.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 and the distance pulled or pushed increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Purify Food and Drink
allSpells.description: All nonmagical food and drink within a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range is purified and rendered free of poison and disease.

allSpells.name: Pyrotechnics
allSpells.description:
Choose an area of nonmagical flame that you can see and that fits within a 5-foot cube within range. You can extinguish the fire in that area, and you create either fireworks or smoke when you do so.

**Fireworks.** The target explodes with a dazzling display of colors. Each creature within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become blinded until the end of your next turn.

**Smoke.** Thick black smoke spreads out from the target in a 20-foot radius, moving around corners. The area of the smoke is heavily obscured. The smoke persists for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it.

allSpells.name: Quantum Lock
allSpells.description:
You lock a creature into a state of quantum uncertainty. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On failure:

- The target exists in multiple states simultaneously

- At the start of each turn, roll 1d4 to determine their state:

- 1: Solid - normal actions, but cannot move

- 2: Gaseous - can move through creatures and objects, cannot attack or cast spells

- 3: Phased - resistance to all damage, but attacks have disadvantage

- 4: Duplicated - two of them exist until end of turn (both can act, damage shared)

- The target can repeat the save at the end of each turn

**Sovereign Attention:** Karthayne finds uncertainty beautiful.

allSpells.name: Raise Dead
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
You return a dead creature you touch to life, provided that it has been dead no longer than 10 days. If the creature's soul is both willing and at liberty to rejoin the body, the creature returns to life with 1 hit point.

This spell also neutralizes any poison and cures nonmagical diseases that affected the creature at the time it died. This spell doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, or similar effects; if these aren't first removed prior to casting the spell, they take effect when the creature returns to life. The spell can't return an undead creature to life.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a -4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time the target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Sanctified Blood from Veinspire mixed with Marrow-Silver dust from the Ossuary can substitute for the diamond, the combined essence of life and death serving as a bridge for the returning soul.

allSpells.name: Rary's Telepathic Bond (Ritual)
allSpells.components: V, S, M (pieces of eggshell from two different kinds of creatures)
allSpells.description:
You forge a telepathic link among up to eight willing creatures of your choice within range, psychically linking each creature to all the others for the duration. Creatures with Intelligence scores of 2 or less aren't affected by this spell.

Until the spell ends, the targets can communicate telepathically through the bond whether or not they have a common language. The communication is possible over any distance, though it can't extend to other planes of existence.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Fragments of Bloom Hound eggshell and Veinspire Crawler shell can serve as the material component, creatures from different domains creating the necessary sympathetic connection.

allSpells.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
allSpells.description:
A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength until the spell ends.

At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

allSpells.name: Ray of Frost
allSpells.description: A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
allSpells.higherLevels: The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

allSpells.name: Ray of Sickness
allSpells.description: A ray of sickening greenish energy lashes out toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also poisoned until the end of your next turn.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Reality Gambit
allSpells.description:
You embrace Karthayne's chaos. For the duration, whenever you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can choose to roll a d20 twice. You don't know which result you'll get until after you've committed to using this feature - the DM secretly rolls to determine which of your two results applies.

If both rolls would succeed, you critically succeed. If both would fail, you critically fail.

**Sovereign Attention:** Karthayne watches all who gamble with fate.

allSpells.name: Reality Unwritten
allSpells.components: V, S, M (something that has existed in multiple contradictory states simultaneously)
allSpells.description:
You invoke Karthayne's fundamental domain - the contradiction at the heart of creation. Choose one:

**Creature:** A creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On failure, roll 1d4:

1. The creature never existed - they are erased from history and reality

2. The creature always existed everywhere - they are spread across reality and effectively destroyed

3. The creature becomes their opposite - alignment, goals, and personality invert

4. The creature exists in superposition - 50% chance each round of being present or absent

**Event:** An event that occurred within the last hour is rewritten. It may have happened, may not have, or may have happened differently. The DM determines the new reality.

**Object:** An object becomes contradictory - both whole and shattered, both real and imaginary, both here and elsewhere.

**Limitation:** The Thirteen cannot be affected by the Creature option - their existence is anchored by stolen divine essence that transcends mortal contradiction. However, their servants, avatars, and manifestations are valid targets.

**Sovereign Attention:** Karthayne considers this spell a prayer. He always notices. He always responds - though his response may be favorable, unfavorable, or incomprehensible.

allSpells.name: Realm of Echoes
allSpells.description:
You create a realm where sound and silence coexist impossibly. Within 1 mile:

- All sounds echo infinitely, growing softer but never stopping

- You can hear any conversation that occurs within the area

- Creatures cannot determine your location by sound

- All Deception checks fail automatically (the echoes reveal all lies)

- Thunder damage is doubled

When the spell ends, all accumulated echoes release at once - a deafening roar audible 10 miles away.

allSpells.name: Refining Cut
allSpells.components: S, M (a blade worth at least 1 sp)
allSpells.description: You make a weapon attack with surgical precision. If the attack hits, it deals an additional 1d8 slashing damage. If the target has any physical imperfections you're aware of (scars, wounds, deformities), you have advantage on the attack.
allSpells.higherLevels: The additional damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Reflection Prison
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a shard of mirror)
allSpells.description:
You trap a creature in a prison of mirrors reflecting their worst selves. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure:

- They are restrained, surrounded by mirrors only they can see

- They take 3d8 psychic damage at the start of each turn as they confront their flaws

- They can use their action to make another Wisdom save to escape

A creature that escapes is frightened of you until the end of their next turn.

allSpells.name: Regenerate
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a prayer wheel and holy water)
allSpells.description:
You touch a creature and stimulate its natural healing ability. The target regains 4d8 + 15 hit points. For the duration of the spell, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns (10 hit points each minute).

The target's severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are restored after 2 minutes. If you have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the spell instantaneously causes the limb to knit to the stump.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Sanctified Blood from a temple of the Crimson Matron can substitute for holy water.

allSpells.name: Reincarnate
allSpells.components: V, S, M (rare oils and unguents worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
You touch a dead humanoid or a piece of a dead humanoid. Provided that the creature has been dead no longer than 10 days, the spell forms a new adult body for it and then calls the soul to enter that body. If the target's soul isn't free or willing to do so, the spell fails.

The magic fashions a new body for the creature to inhabit, which likely causes the creature's race to change. The DM rolls a d100 and consults the following table to determine what form the creature takes when restored to life, or the DM chooses a form.

| d100 | Race |

|------|------|

| 01-04 | Dragonborn |

| 05-13 | Dwarf, hill |

| 14-21 | Dwarf, mountain |

| 22-25 | Elf, dark |

| 26-34 | Elf, high |

| 35-42 | Elf, wood |

| 43-46 | Gnome, forest |

| 47-52 | Gnome, rock |

| 53-56 | Half-elf |

| 57-60 | Half-orc |

| 61-68 | Halfling, lightfoot |

| 69-76 | Halfling, stout |

| 77-96 | Human |

| 97-00 | Tiefling |

The reincarnated creature recalls its former life and experiences. It retains the capabilities it had in its original form, except it exchanges its original race for the new one and changes its racial traits accordingly.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Oils infused with Mycelium Extract from the Blooming Rot can substitute, the fungal essence of transformation and rebirth guiding the soul into its new vessel.

allSpells.name: Remnant Aura
allSpells.components: V, S, M (gold dust worth 100 gp)
allSpells.description:
You radiate pre-Usurpation energy. For the duration, you and allies within 10 feet:

- Have resistance to necrotic damage from Sovereign sources

- Have advantage on saving throws against Sovereign abilities

- Deal an additional 1d6 radiant damage to Sovereign creatures with weapon attacks

allSpells.name: Remnant Blade
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a piece of metal from before the Usurpation)
allSpells.description: A blade of golden light forms in your hand. You can use it as a melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals 2d8 radiant damage on a hit. Against Sovereign creatures and their servants, it deals an additional 1d8 radiant damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: Damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Remnant Blessing
allSpells.components: V, S, M (gold dust worth 200 gp)
allSpells.description:
You bestow a fragment of the Maker's protection. A willing creature you touch gains:

- Resistance to necrotic damage

- Advantage on saving throws against Sovereign abilities

- Immunity to being frightened by Sovereign creatures or servants

- Their attacks count as magical for purposes of overcoming resistance

The creature's eyes faintly glow gold for the duration.

allSpells.name: Remnant Light
allSpells.description:
You touch an object and awaken the Maker's memory within it. The object remembers what it was before the Usurpation - before the world became a corpse - and briefly glows with that primordial warmth.

For the duration, the object sheds dim golden light in a 10-foot radius. More importantly, anything illuminated by this light reveals its *true age* - illusions show the moment they were created, disguised creatures flicker to show their real form for an instant each round, and objects display signs of their actual wear and history.

Sovereign corruption appears as dark veins or stains when illuminated. The light doesn't dispel anything - it only reveals.

allSpells.name: Remnant Memory
allSpells.description:
You touch an object or location and see echoes of its past from before the Usurpation. You witness up to 10 minutes of events from the object's history, chosen by the DM as most significant. For locations that existed before the Usurpation, you may glimpse what it looked like when the Maker still lived.

This spell cannot show events after the Usurpation - the Sovereigns' theft corrupted the world's memory.

allSpells.name: Remnant Purification
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a shard of the Maker's essence worth 10,000 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You channel the Maker's cleansing light to purge Sovereign corruption. Choose one of the following effects:

**Purge Servant:** Target a creature bound to a Sovereign. They must make a Charisma saving throw. On failure, their connection to their Sovereign is permanently severed. They lose all powers granted by that Sovereign but retain their soul and free will. They become visible to their former master as a "hole" in their domain - Sovereigns can sense their betrayal from any distance.

**Cleanse Domain:** You purify a 60-foot radius area of Sovereign influence. Sovereign corruption (tainted terrain, lingering curses, domain effects) is dispelled. This creates a "dead zone" that the affected Sovereign cannot perceive or influence for 24 hours.

**Restore Memory:** Target a creature who has had memories consumed by Vor'Kael or erased by Sovereign magic. They regain all lost memories. If used on someone who was "forgotten" - erased from existence - they become partially real again (others can remember them, though their physical form remains unstable without further intervention).

**Sovereign Attention:** All Thirteen feel this spell as an echo of the Maker's authority over them. The Sovereign most affected by your choice takes notice and remembers you.

allSpells.name: Remnant Restoration
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a fragment of pre-Usurpation material worth 500 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You channel the Maker's healing light. A creature you touch:

- Regains 8d8 hit points

- Is cured of all diseases and conditions (except curses placed by Sovereigns)

- Has disadvantage removed from all future saves against Sovereign effects for 24 hours
allSpells.higherLevels: Healing increases by 2d8 for each slot level above 5th.

allSpells.name: Remnant Resurrection
allSpells.components: V, S, M (diamonds worth 1,000 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You channel the Maker's creative power to restore life. You touch a creature that has been dead no more than 10 days. The creature returns to life with 1 HP, free of any diseases or poisons.

This spell cannot resurrect creatures killed by Sovereign-empowered death effects, but it is otherwise unrestricted - no body is required if you have a personal item of the deceased.

**Sovereign Attention:** All Thirteen feel this spell as an echo of the Maker. They do not like being reminded.

allSpells.name: Remnant Sanctuary
allSpells.components: V, S, M (pre-Usurpation materials worth 1,000 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You create a sanctuary blessed by the Maker's lingering power. Within the 60-foot radius:

- Sovereign magic is weakened (all damage from Sovereign sources is halved)

- Creatures have advantage on saving throws against Sovereign abilities

- Undead and Sovereign servants cannot willingly enter

- Healing magic restores an additional 2d8 HP

allSpells.name: Remnant Shield
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction (when you are hit by an attack from a Sovereign creature or their servant)
allSpells.description: Pre-Usurpation light flares around you. The triggering attack has disadvantage, potentially causing it to miss. Until the start of your next turn, you have resistance to necrotic damage from Sovereign sources.

allSpells.name: Remnant Sight
allSpells.description:
Your eyes glow faintly gold as you see the world as it was before the Usurpation. For the duration:

- You can see invisible creatures and objects

- You can perceive Sovereign corruption as a dark stain overlaying affected creatures and locations

- You can identify objects or locations touched by divine power (Maker or Sovereign)

- You have advantage on saves against illusions

allSpells.name: Remnant Spark
allSpells.description:
You channel a spark of the Maker's original fire. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 radiant damage. Sovereign creatures and their direct servants take an additional 1d4 radiant damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 at 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

allSpells.name: Remnant Weapon
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a weapon and gold dust worth 200 gp)
allSpells.description:
You infuse a weapon with pre-Usurpation energy. For the duration:

- The weapon sheds bright light in 20 feet, dim light for another 20 feet

- It deals an additional 2d8 radiant damage on hit

- Against Sovereign creatures and servants, it scores critical hits on 19-20

- The wielder has advantage on saving throws against Sovereign effects

allSpells.name: Remnant Wrath
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a shard of pre-Usurpation crystal worth 2,500 gp)
allSpells.description:
You unleash the Maker's fury. All creatures in a 30-foot radius sphere must make Constitution saving throws:

- 12d8 radiant damage on failure, half on success

- Sovereign creatures and servants take an additional 4d8 radiant damage

- Creatures that fail are blinded for 1 minute

allSpells.name: Remove Curse
allSpells.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

allSpells.name: Resistance
allSpells.description: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one saving throw of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the saving throw. The spell then ends.

allSpells.name: Resonant Attunement
allSpells.description:
You attune yourself to the fundamental frequency of reality. For the duration:

- You can sense the vibrations of all creatures within 120 feet (blindsight)

- You cannot be surprised, and have advantage on initiative

- As a bonus action, you can "read" a creature's frequency to learn their current HP, any conditions affecting them, and their emotional state

- As an action, you can send a targeted resonance to one creature within 60 feet - they must make a Constitution save or be incapacitated until the start of your next turn as their body vibrates painfully

- You can communicate telepathically with any creature you can sense

**Special:** While attuned, you can sense if anyone is scrying on you or your location.

allSpells.name: Resonant Bond
allSpells.description: You create a harmonic link between yourself and a willing creature. For the duration, you can sense each other's general emotional state and direction (within 1 mile). If either of you takes damage, the other knows immediately.
allSpells.higherLevels: You can link an additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

allSpells.name: Resonant Cascade
allSpells.description:
You release stored resonant energy in a devastating cascade. All creatures within 60 feet must make Constitution saving throws:

- 6d10 thunder damage on failure, half on success

- Creatures that fail are pushed 20 feet away and knocked prone

- Structures in the area take double damage
allSpells.higherLevels: Damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 5th.

allSpells.name: Resonant Communication
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a tuning fork attuned to a specific creature)
allSpells.description:
You establish a vibrational link with a creature you have met. For the duration, you can speak telepathically with them regardless of distance. You can also share sensory information - they can see through your eyes or hear through your ears if you allow it (and vice versa).

The link is undetectable and cannot be intercepted.

allSpells.name: Resonant Deflection
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction (when you or a creature within 30 feet is targeted by a spell or ranged attack)
allSpells.description:
You vibrate the air at a precise counter-frequency to deflect incoming attacks. The triggering spell or ranged attack is redirected to a new target of your choice within 30 feet of the original target. Use the original attack roll or spell save DC against the new target.

If the new target is the original attacker, they have disadvantage on their saving throw as they're caught off-guard by their own attack returning.
allSpells.higherLevels: When cast at 6th level or higher, you can deflect spells of up to 5th level. At 8th level, you can deflect any spell.

allSpells.name: Resonant Duplication
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a perfect mirror worth 5,000 gp)
allSpells.description:
You vibrate at a frequency that creates a resonant duplicate of yourself. The duplicate appears within 30 feet and lasts for the duration:

- The duplicate has your statistics, HP, and abilities, but cannot cast spells of 6th level or higher

- You and the duplicate share a telepathic bond and can perceive through each other's senses

- The duplicate acts on your initiative, taking a full turn

- Damage dealt to one of you is not shared

- If the duplicate drops to 0 HP, it shatters and you take 4d10 psychic damage

- Spells and effects that target "you" can target either or both versions

**Special:** You can swap positions with your duplicate as a bonus action (teleportation).

allSpells.name: Resonant Empathy
allSpells.description:
You attune to the emotional frequencies of creatures around you. For the duration, you know the emotional state of all creatures within 60 feet. You have advantage on Insight, Persuasion, Intimidation, and Deception checks against them.

Additionally, you can sense if a creature intends violence toward you or your allies, granting you and allies advantage on initiative rolls against that creature.

allSpells.name: Resonant Mapping
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a tuning fork worth at least 50 gp)
allSpells.description:
You send resonant pulses through the surrounding area and receive detailed information about everything within 500 feet. You learn:

- The exact layout of all structures, tunnels, and chambers

- The location of all creatures (though not their identity)

- Hidden doors, traps, and secret passages

- Areas of magical significance (they resonate differently)

This spell doesn't work in areas of magical silence or where sound cannot propagate.

allSpells.name: Resonant Message
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a small tuning fork)
allSpells.description:
You attune two objects to the same vibrational frequency. For the duration, striking, breaking, or significantly disturbing one object causes the other to vibrate noticeably - regardless of distance (same plane only).

This is commonly used as an alarm system (break a thread, a bell rings elsewhere) or a signal device (tap a pattern on one stone, the other taps back). The objects must be non-magical and weigh no more than 5 pounds each.
allSpells.higherLevels: At 2nd level, you can attune three objects. At 3rd level, objects can transmit simple sounds (taps, scrapes) rather than just vibrations.

allSpells.name: Resonant Restructuring
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a tuning fork made of the target material)
allSpells.description:
You vibrate matter at its fundamental frequency to reshape it. You can affect up to a 20-foot cube of nonmagical material:

- **Stone/Metal:** Reshape into any form, create passages through walls, seal doors permanently, forge objects without tools

- **Wood/Organic:** Heal or kill plants, shape living wood, accelerate or reverse growth

- **Water/Ice:** Freeze, melt, purify, or shape permanently (ice becomes stable at room temperature)

Objects created are permanent and of masterwork quality. You can also use this to repair damaged structures or objects, or to destroy them by vibrating them apart (10d10 thunder damage to structures).

allSpells.name: Resonant Rewriting
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a tuning fork that has been struck at the moment of creation, worth 25,000 gp)
allSpells.description:
You vibrate a creature or object at its fundamental frequency, then rewrite that frequency. Choose one:

**Creature (willing or incapacitated):** Permanently alter their form. This functions as True Polymorph but is instantaneous and cannot be dispelled - the new form becomes their true form. You can also use this to cure any condition, disease, or curse, or to restore youth (reduce age by up to 50 years).

**Object:** Transform any object into any other object of equal or lesser size. The transformation is permanent and undetectable. You can also repair any object to perfect condition, or destroy any object utterly (no save, nothing remains).

**Location:** Attune a 100-foot radius area to a specific frequency. You can make the area hostile to specific creature types (they take 4d10 thunder damage when entering), or welcoming (creatures you designate heal 2d10 when they enter). This effect is permanent until dispelled.

**Special:** This spell can undo the effects of other Resonant spells, including permanent transformations.

allSpells.name: Resonant Scrying
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a focus attuned to the target)
allSpells.description:
You attune to a creature's vibrational signature - the unique frequency their existence creates. Rather than watching them, you *feel* them.

For the duration, you experience:

- Physical sensations they feel (pain, pleasure, temperature, hunger)

- The vibrations around them (footsteps of nearby creatures, the hum of magic, the rumble of machinery)

- Their heartbeat and breathing patterns (detecting stress, fear, or calm)

- Environmental sounds through bone conduction (muffled voices, distant music, structural groaning)

You cannot see, but you know with certainty if they're being touched, if they're lying down or standing, if they're in combat, and if they're alone or surrounded. You perceive their location as direction and distance from you.

**Two-Way Resonance:** Powerful emotions you experience while scrying may bleed through to the target - a brief moment of your fear, your joy, your anger. The target doesn't know the source but may feel inexplicably emotional.
allSpells.higherLevels: At 7th level, you can establish resonance with an object the target owns instead of needing a personal focus.

allSpells.name: Resonant Strike
allSpells.description: You infuse your attacks with resonant energy. For the duration, your weapon attacks deal an additional 2d6 thunder damage. Once per turn when you hit a creature, you can force them to make a Constitution save or be knocked prone from the vibration.

allSpells.name: Resonate
allSpells.description:
You vibrate at a frequency that resonates with pre-Usurpation structures and magic. For the duration:

- Pre-Usurpation magical effects within 30 feet function at full power (even if degraded)

- Sovereign-based magic within 30 feet is weakened (creatures have advantage on saves against it)

- You can see pre-Usurpation enchantments, wards, and hidden structures

- You deal an additional 2d6 radiant damage to Sovereign creatures

This spell is anathema to the Thirteen. Any Sovereign creature that sees you casting it recognizes you as someone who remembers.

allSpells.name: Resurrection
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
You touch a dead creature that has been dead for no more than a century, that didn't die of old age, and that isn't undead. If its soul is free and willing, the target returns to life with all its hit points.

This spell neutralizes any poisons and cures normal diseases afflicting the creature when it died. It doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, and the like; if such effects aren't removed prior to casting the spell, they afflict the target on its return to life.

This spell closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a -4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time the target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.

Casting this spell to restore life to a creature that has been dead for one year or longer taxes you greatly. Until you finish a long rest, you can't cast spells again, and you have disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Heart-Stone worth 1,000 gp can substitute for the diamond. In the Ossuary Kingdom, resurrection is viewed with suspicion by the servants of the Hollow Crown.

allSpells.name: Reverse Gravity
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a lodestone and iron filings)
allSpells.description:
This spell reverses gravity in a 50-foot-radius, 100-foot high cylinder centered on a point within range. All creatures and objects that aren't somehow anchored to the ground in the area fall upward and reach the top of the area when you cast this spell. A creature can make a Dexterity saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, thus avoiding the fall.

If some solid object (such as a ceiling) is encountered in this fall, falling objects and creatures strike it just as they would during a normal downward fall. If an object or creature reaches the top of the area without striking anything, it remains there, oscillating slightly, for the duration.

At the end of the duration, affected objects and creatures fall back down.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Clot-Iron filings can substitute for the iron filings.

allSpells.name: Revivify
allSpells.components: V, S, M (diamonds worth 300 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Heart-Stone crystals worth 300 gp from Veinspire can substitute for diamonds.

allSpells.name: Rope Trick
allSpells.components: V, S, M (powdered corn extract and a twisted loop of parchment)
allSpells.description:
You touch a length of rope that is up to 60 feet long. One end of the rope then rises into the air until the whole rope hangs perpendicular to the ground. At the upper end of the rope, an invisible entrance opens to an extradimensional space that lasts until the spell ends.

The extradimensional space can be reached by climbing to the top of the rope. The space can hold as many as eight Medium or smaller creatures. The rope can be pulled into the space, making the rope disappear from view outside the space.

Attacks and spells cannot cross through the entrance into or out of the extradimensional space, but those inside can see out of it as if through a 3-foot-by-5-foot window centered on the rope.

Anything inside the extradimensional space drops out when the spell ends.

allSpells.name: Sacred Flame
allSpells.description: Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.
allSpells.higherLevels: The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

allSpells.name: Sanctuary
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a small silver mirror)
allSpells.description:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell does not protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.

If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

allSpells.name: Scar the Soul
allSpells.description:
You reach beyond flesh to wound the soul itself. Make a melee spell attack against a creature. On a hit, the target takes 4d10 psychic damage and gains a soul scar - a permanent wound visible only to those with divine sight or truesight.

The soul scar reduces the target's maximum HP by 10 until they receive Greater Restoration, Wish, or similar magic. A creature can have multiple soul scars. Each one represents a wound that even death may not fully heal.
allSpells.higherLevels: Damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Scatter
allSpells.description: The air quivers around up to five creatures of your choice that you can see within range. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to resist this spell. You teleport each affected target to an unoccupied space that you can see within 120 feet of you. That space must be on the ground or on a floor.

allSpells.name: Schrödinger's Apocalypse
allSpells.components: V, S, M (something that has been both destroyed and preserved)
allSpells.description:
You create an explosion that exists in superposition - both devastating and harmless until observed. Choose a point you can see. A 60-foot radius sphere around that point is affected:

- Roll a d20 secretly (DM rolls)

- On 1-10: Nothing happens. The explosion was never real.

- On 11-20: 20d6 force damage to all creatures in the area (Dexterity save for half). Structures take double damage.

Neither you nor any creature knows which result occurred until someone takes an action to "observe" the area (enter it, scry on it, etc.).

**Sovereign Attention:** Karthayne loves uncertainty. If you ever learn to predict or manipulate this spell's outcome, it stops working for you forever.

allSpells.name: Schrödinger's Strike
allSpells.description:
You create an attack that exists in superposition. Target a creature within range. The attack both hits and misses simultaneously until observed - roll a d20:

- 1-10: The attack misses

- 11-20: The attack hits, dealing 6d8 force damage

If you have advantage or disadvantage on the roll, roll twice and the DM chooses which result "collapses" into reality.
allSpells.higherLevels: Damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Scorching Ray
allSpells.description:
You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Scrying
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a focus worth at least 1,000 gp, such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water)
allSpells.description:
You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

| Knowledge | Save Modifier |

|-----------|---------------|

| Secondhand (you have heard of the target) | +5 |

| Firsthand (you have met the target) | +0 |

| Familiar (you know the target well) | -5 |

| Connection | Save Modifier |

|------------|---------------|

| Likeness or picture | -2 |

| Possession or garment | -4 |

| Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like | -10 |

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see invisible objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A polished Void-Glass mirror from the Devoured Courts serves as an exceptional focus, its connection to absent things allowing glimpses across vast distances.

allSpells.name: Scrying Trap
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a shard of mirrored glass)
allSpells.description:
You set a magical trap for anyone who tries to observe you magically. For the duration, whenever a creature attempts to target you with a divination spell or effect:

- They must make a Wisdom saving throw or take 3d6 psychic damage as their own sight turns against them
