For the duration, any creature can step into the target plant and exit from the destination plant by using 5 feet of movement.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Blooming Rot, this spell can work with the great fungal stalks that serve as the domain's equivalent of trees.

allSpells.name: Tree Stride
allSpells.description: You gain the ability to enter a tree and move from inside it to inside another tree of the same kind within 500 feet. Both trees must be living and at least the same size as you. You must use 5 feet of movement to enter a tree. You instantly know the location of all other trees of the same kind within 500 feet and can pass into one of those trees or step out of the tree you're in.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Blooming Rot, this spell can work with the great fungal stalks that serve as the domain's equivalent of trees.

allSpells.name: True Hunger
allSpells.description:
You embody the Hollow Empress's hunger. For the duration:

- Whenever you deal damage, regain HP equal to half the damage

- When targeted by a spell of 3rd level or lower, use your reaction to negate it and regain HP equal to 5 x the spell's level

- At start of each turn, take 2d6 necrotic damage if you didn't damage a creature on your previous turn

**Cost:** When the spell ends, you must make a DC 18 Wisdom save or be compelled to consume something meaningful - a memory, relationship, or treasured possession. This DC cannot be reduced by any means; it represents Vor'Kael's hunger, not your own power.

**Sovereign Attention:** Vor'Kael notices every casting. She considers it flattery.

allSpells.name: True Polymorph
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a drop of mercury, a dollop of gum arabic, and a wisp of smoke)
allSpells.description:
Choose one creature or nonmagical object that you can see within range. You transform the creature into a different creature, the creature into an object, or the object into a creature. The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the transformation becomes permanent.

Shapechangers aren't affected by this spell. An unwilling creature can make a Wisdom saving throw, and if it succeeds, it isn't affected by this spell.

**Creature into Creature:** The new form can be any kind you choose whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's.

**Object into Creature:** You can turn an object into any kind of creature, as long as the creature's size is no larger than the object's size and the creature's challenge rating is 9 or lower.

**Creature into Object:** The creature transforms along with whatever it is wearing and carrying into that form.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Void-Dust, gum arabic, and smoke from Ember-Salt can substitute for the standard components.

allSpells.name: True Reflection
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a mirror that has reflected a truth)
allSpells.description:
You force a creature to see their true self. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure:

- They see themselves as they truly are - every flaw, every hidden shame, every secret sin

- 10d10 psychic damage

- Stunned for 1 minute (can repeat save at end of each turn)

- For 24 hours after, they have disadvantage on Deception checks

On success, half damage only.

**Special:** If cast on a creature that is disguised, polymorphed, or otherwise not in their true form, they are forced into their true form and have disadvantage on the save.

allSpells.name: True Resurrection
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a sprinkle of holy water and diamonds worth at least 25,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
allSpells.description:
You touch a creature that has been dead for no longer than 200 years and that died for any reason except old age. If the creature's soul is free and willing, the creature is restored to life with all its hit points.

This spell closes all wounds, neutralizes any poison, cures all diseases, and lifts any curses affecting the creature when it died. The spell replaces damaged or missing organs or limbs.

The spell can even provide a new body if the original no longer exists, in which case you must speak the creature's name. The creature then appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 10 feet of you.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Heart-Stone worth 25,000 gp and Sanctified Blood can substitute. This spell is viewed with suspicion in the Ossuary Kingdom, where the Hollow Crown's servants guard the boundary between life and death.

allSpells.name: True Seeing
allSpells.components: V, S, M (an ointment for the eyes that costs 25 gp; is made from mushroom powder, saffron, and fat; and is consumed by the spell)
allSpells.description: This spell gives the willing creature you touch the ability to see things as they actually are. For the duration, the creature has truesight, notices secret doors hidden by magic, and can see into the Ethereal Plane, all out to a range of 120 feet.
allSpells.ashenRealms: An ointment made from Rot-Spore powder, Ember-Salt, and animal fat can substitute.

allSpells.name: True Strike
allSpells.description: You point a finger at a target in range. Your magic grants you a brief insight into the target's defenses. On your next turn, you gain advantage on your first attack roll against the target, provided that this spell hasn't ended.

allSpells.name: Tsunami
allSpells.description:
A wall of water springs into existence at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 300 feet long, 300 feet high, and 50 feet thick. The wall lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d10 bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

At the start of each of your turns after the wall appears, the wall, along with any creatures in it, moves 50 feet away from you. Any Huge or smaller creature inside the wall or whose space the wall enters when it moves must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take 5d10 bludgeoning damage. A creature can take this damage only once per round. At the end of the turn, the wall's height is reduced by 50 feet, and the damage creatures take from the spell on subsequent rounds is reduced by 1d10. When the wall reaches 0 feet in height, the spell ends.

A creature caught in the wall can move by swimming. Because of the force of the wave, though, the creature must make a successful Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC in order to move at all.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Near the Crimson Matron's domain, the water takes on a blood-red tinge.

allSpells.name: Ultimate Reflection
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a mirror that has reflected a god)
allSpells.description:
You trap a creature within their own reflection for eternity. The target must make a Charisma saving throw:

- On failure: The target is imprisoned within a reflection of themselves. They are conscious but can only observe reality through reflective surfaces. Only Wish, a Sovereign's intervention, or breaking every mirror in the world can free them.

- On success: 12d10 psychic damage and the target is frightened of reflective surfaces for 1 year.

**Limitation:** The Thirteen cannot be imprisoned by this spell - they transcend their own reflections. Against a Sovereign, this spell deals 12d10 psychic damage on a failed save (half on success) but cannot trap them.

**Special:** If cast on a creature that has killed their own reflection, the spell fails but the caster takes 10d10 psychic damage as Ultharion punishes them for wasting his power.

allSpells.name: Un-Being
allSpells.components: V, S, M (an object that was erased from existence by Vor'Kael's domain, worth 50,000 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You temporarily cease to exist. For the duration:

- You cannot be perceived, targeted, or affected by anything - you are not invisible, you simply *aren't*

- You can move through any space, including solid matter

- You can perceive the world as a ghostly observer

- You cannot interact with anything physical or magical

- You can end the spell early as a bonus action to reappear in any unoccupied space you can perceive

When you reappear, you can bring one object or willing creature with you that you touched while un-existing. They experience the journey as a moment of total emptiness.

**Risk:** If you lose concentration while inside solid matter, you are shunted to the nearest empty space and take 10d10 force damage.

allSpells.name: Unmake
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a valuable object worth 500 gp, consumed)
allSpells.description:
You unmake something. Choose one:

**Object:** A nonmagical object up to 10 feet in any dimension ceases to exist. It doesn't break - it simply never was. Creatures wearing or wielding it take 4d10 force damage.

**Creature:** A creature must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 10d8 force damage on failure as parts of them briefly cease to exist. Half on success.

**Concept (Rare):** With DM permission, target a simple concept in a limited area (the color red in a room, the emotion of fear in one creature, the sound of a specific bell). The concept is gone for 24 hours.

allSpells.name: Unseen Servant
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a piece of string and a bit of wood)
allSpells.description:
This spell creates an invisible, mindless, shapeless, Medium force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 2, and it cannot attack. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command the servant to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The servant can perform simple tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.

If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

allSpells.name: Unwrite History
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction (when you or a creature within 60 feet takes damage or fails a saving throw)
allSpells.description:
You briefly erase the last few seconds. The triggering event never happened - the attack misses, the saving throw hasn't been rolled yet. The affected creature can then take a different action, or the attacker must choose a different target.

This spell cannot be used on the same event twice. Reality resists being unwritten repeatedly.

allSpells.name: Vampiric Touch
allSpells.description: The touch of your shadow-wreathed hand can siphon life force from others to heal your wounds. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt. Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Veil of the Forgotten
allSpells.components: V, S, M (ash from a burned portrait)
allSpells.description:
You wrap yourself in the essence of those who have been erased from memory. For the duration:

- You are invisible to divination magic and cannot be targeted by effects that require knowing your name

- Creatures who don't already know you have difficulty noticing you (disadvantage on Perception checks to see you)

- You can pass through wards designed to exclude specific individuals (you register as "no one")

However, creatures who genuinely remember someone who was erased can see through this veil - you appear to them as a ghostly silhouette of the person they remember.

allSpells.name: Veil of the Nameless
allSpells.description:
You create a field that strips identity. You and creatures you choose within 10 feet:

- Cannot be identified by magical means

- Appear as generic, forgettable versions of their species

- Have advantage on saving throws against effects that target them by name or personal connection

allSpells.name: Vein of the World
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a gallon of divine blood, worth 10,000 gp)
allSpells.description:
You open a connection to the world's arterial system. A geyser of boiling blood erupts at a point you can see:

- 100-foot-radius cylinder, 300 feet high

- 10d10 necrotic damage immediately (Dex save half)

- Area becomes flooded with blood 10 feet deep

- Creatures in the blood take 4d10 necrotic at start of each turn

- You sense all creatures with blood within 1 mile through the blood connection

The blood slowly recedes when the spell ends, leaving the area stained. Nothing will grow there for a year.

**Sovereign Attention:** Mareatha feels this spell like a pulse in her own veins.

allSpells.name: Veinpath
allSpells.description:
You open a path through the world's vascular system - the network of blood-rivers and arterial channels that run beneath the surface. A portal of swirling crimson opens at a point you can see and connects to another point within 30 feet that you can also see. Creatures can step through one portal and emerge from the other.

The portal space is unsettling - those who pass through catch glimpses of vast chambers of blood and distant heartbeats. They must make a Wisdom save against your spell save DC or be shaken (disadvantage on the next attack roll they make within 1 minute).
allSpells.higherLevels: Range between portals increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

allSpells.name: Vicious Mockery
allSpells.description: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
allSpells.higherLevels: This spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

allSpells.name: Vitriolic Sphere
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a drop of giant slug bile)
allSpells.description: You point at a location within range, and a glowing, 1-foot-diameter ball of emerald acid streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d4 acid damage and another 5d4 acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 4th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Bile from one of the Blooming Rot's giant slugs can substitute for the standard component.

allSpells.name: Voice of the Silent
allSpells.description:
You speak with a voice heard directly in the mind, bypassing all barriers. For the duration:

- Telepathy has unlimited range within the same plane

- When you give a Command, target has disadvantage on save; command can be complex (up to 25 words)

- Cast Suggestion on any creature you perceive telepathically without line of sight

- Voice cannot be silenced, blocked, or overheard by anyone you don't choose

**Cost:** For 24 hours after, you cannot speak above a whisper. Speaking normally deals 3d10 psychic damage.

allSpells.name: Void Anchor
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a compass that points nowhere, worth 300 gp)
allSpells.description:
You anchor a location to the void between domains. A 30-foot radius area becomes partially outside normal reality:

- Divination cannot penetrate the area

- Teleportation into or out of the area requires a spellcasting ability check against your spell save DC

- Creatures have advantage on saves against Sovereign abilities

- Time passes normally inside but is difficult to track from outside

The area feels slightly unreal. Objects left here for more than 24 hours begin to fade at the edges.

allSpells.name: Void Cache
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a container that has held something forgotten)
allSpells.description:
You create a permanent pocket of non-existence anchored to an object. The cache can hold up to 500 pounds of material in a space that doesn't exist. Objects inside:

- Cannot be detected by any means, including divine perception

- Do not age, decay, or change in any way

- Can be accessed only by you or creatures you designate

You can create multiple caches (up to your proficiency bonus). Each requires a different anchor object. If the anchor is destroyed, the contents are lost to the void forever.

**Special:** Living creatures cannot be stored, but corpses can - and they remain perfectly preserved, as if time doesn't pass inside.

allSpells.name: Void Cloak
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a piece of fabric that has passed through the Unclaimed)
allSpells.description:
You wrap yourself in void-stuff. For the duration:

- You are invisible to divination magic and divine sight

- You have advantage on saving throws against Sovereign abilities

- Once per minute, you can become invisible (as the spell) for 1 round as a bonus action

allSpells.name: Void Collapse
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a shard of the Unclaimed's boundary, worth 10,000 gp)
allSpells.description:
You collapse yourself into a point of non-existence, then expand back into reality - but you bring the void with you. When you reappear (in the same spot or any unoccupied space within 500 feet), reality around your arrival point is fundamentally compromised.

A 120-foot radius around your arrival point becomes a **Void Scar** for 7 days:

- Divine magic cannot function (spells from Sovereign sources automatically fail)

- Teleportation into or out of the area is impossible

- Creatures cannot be scryed upon while inside

- All creatures in the area (including you) are invisible to the Thirteen

- Time flows strangely - short rests take 10 minutes, long rests take 4 hours

- The area feels deeply wrong; creatures who aren't used to the Unclaimed must make a DC 18 Wisdom save each hour or gain 1 level of exhaustion from existential dread

This spell is used by Free City mages to create temporary sanctuaries from divine oversight - but the Sovereigns have learned to recognize the absence a Void Scar creates.

allSpells.name: Void Door
allSpells.description:
You tear open a door into nothing. A 10-foot diameter portal of absolute darkness appears at a point you can see. The portal leads to a pocket of void - a space that doesn't exist.

**Trap:** Creatures pushed, thrown, or walking unwittingly into the portal must make a Charisma saving throw or be shunted into the void-pocket. They are removed from play and take 4d10 psychic damage at the start of each of their turns from the experience of non-existence. They can repeat the save at the end of each turn, reappearing in the nearest unoccupied space on success.

**Storage:** Willing creatures can enter the void-pocket safely, experiencing nothing (not even time) until they choose to exit or the spell ends. Objects can be stored similarly.

When the spell ends, everything inside is expelled violently - appearing within 30 feet of where the portal was, in random unoccupied spaces.
allSpells.higherLevels: At 6th level, the portal can be placed up to 500 feet away at a location you've previously seen.

allSpells.name: Void Erasure
allSpells.components: V, S, M (something that was forgotten for at least a century)
allSpells.description:
You attempt to erase something from existence. Choose one:

**Creature:** The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On failure, they are erased from history - memories of them fade, records blank, their impact on the world unravels. They exist but no one remembers them. Only Wish or divine intervention can restore them to memory.

**Object:** A nonmagical object up to 20 feet in any dimension is erased. It never existed. Effects it caused remain, but no one remembers it.

**Effect:** A magical effect or spell is erased as if it never existed. This can undo effects up to 8th level.

**Limitation:** The Thirteen cannot be erased - their existence is woven into the fabric of reality through the stolen essence of the Maker. Attempting to use the Creature option on a Sovereign automatically fails and the caster takes 8d10 psychic damage from the backlash.

allSpells.name: Void Flicker
allSpells.description:
You briefly become uncertain - existing and not-existing simultaneously. Until the start of your next turn:

- Attack rolls against you have disadvantage as attackers aren't sure where you actually are

- You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws

- Divination effects targeting you automatically fail

However, you also cannot be healed or buffed during this time - beneficial spells targeting you also fail to find you.

If you take the Hide action while this spell is active, you can hide even while being observed - observers simply lose track of whether you exist.

allSpells.name: Void Hide
allSpells.description: You partially slip into the void. For the duration, you have advantage on Stealth checks and appear slightly translucent. Divination spells targeting you have disadvantage on any associated ability checks.

allSpells.name: Void Passage
allSpells.description:
You convert a doorway, arch, window, or similar opening into a passage through the void. The opening must have a frame (natural or constructed) - you can't create a void passage in open air.

When a creature steps through the passage, they experience a moment of absolute nothing - no time passes, no sensations register - and then emerge from any other framed opening you've previously marked with this spell (requires 1 minute of concentration to mark; you can maintain up to 5 marks).

**The Void Tax:** Each passage extracts a toll. Choose one when a creature passes through:

- A minute of their memory (their choice which minute, but it's gone)

- Their shadow (doesn't return for 24 hours; they can be identified by its absence)

- A secret (they must speak one aloud before the passage allows exit)

Creatures who refuse to pay are shunted to the nearest unmarked opening within 100 feet.
allSpells.higherLevels: At 7th level, the void tax becomes optional for willing creatures.

allSpells.name: Void Pocket
allSpells.description:
You create a small pocket of non-existence that follows you. Objects placed in the pocket (up to 10 pounds, 1 cubic foot) exist outside normal reality and cannot be detected by any means. You can retrieve items as a bonus action.

If you die while the spell is active, the pocket collapses and its contents are lost forever.

allSpells.name: Void Sanctum
allSpells.components: V, S, M (materials from the Unclaimed worth 5,000 gp)
allSpells.description:
You carve out a space that exists outside divine perception. A 100-foot radius sphere becomes a void sanctum:

- No Sovereign can perceive or influence anything within

- Teleportation into or out of the area is impossible

- Divination magic fails

- Creatures within have advantage on all saving throws against Sovereign abilities

- Time passes normally but feels disconnected from the outside world

The sanctum leaves no trace when it ends, but the Sovereigns eventually notice the gap in their perception.

allSpells.name: Void Static
allSpells.description:
You create a brief flicker of unreality around a creature you can see. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or experience a moment of existential uncertainty - they forget what they were about to do. On a failed save, the target loses their reaction until the start of their next turn.

This spell has no effect on creatures with Intelligence 4 or lower (they don't have enough self-awareness to doubt).

allSpells.name: Void Step
allSpells.description: You step through the void between spaces. Teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. During this teleportation, you pass through a moment of non-existence - you are immune to all damage and effects during the transition, and cannot be tracked or followed by any means.
allSpells.higherLevels: Distance increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

allSpells.name: Void Walk
allSpells.description:
You walk the paths between existence - the spaces where reality forgot to fill in. For the duration, you can perceive and travel through "void seams" - the gaps between things.

**Void Seams:** These appear as faint dark lines along edges, corners, and boundaries. You can slip through any seam you can perceive, emerging from any connected seam within 60 feet. Walls, floors, locked containers - anything with edges has seams.

**Limitations:**

- Seamless surfaces (perfectly spherical objects, magically smoothed walls, natural caves without corners) have no void seams

- Traveling through a seam takes your movement but is instantaneous

- You must begin and end your turn in normal space - you cannot rest within the void

- While walking, you perceive the world as edges and boundaries only. Creatures appear as outlines, objects as wire frames. You have disadvantage on Perception checks that don't involve geometry.

**Danger:** Each seam you pass through has a 5% cumulative chance of attracting something that lives in the gaps. Reset on a long rest.

allSpells.name: Void Whisper
allSpells.description:
You speak a word that briefly doesn't exist. Choose a creature within range - they must make a Wisdom saving throw or forget one specific thing you name: a face they just saw, a word they just heard, a smell they just noticed, or a single sensory detail from the last minute.

The forgotten detail returns after 1 hour, but the creature doesn't realize anything was missing in the meantime. This cantrip cannot erase memories of violence, trauma, or strong emotional significance.

allSpells.name: Waking Dream
allSpells.description:
You blur the line between waking and dreaming for a creature. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or be disoriented until the end of their next turn - they have disadvantage on attack rolls and can't take reactions.

Creatures that don't sleep are immune.

allSpells.name: Wall of Fire
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a small piece of phosphorus)
allSpells.description:
You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals 5d8 fire damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Ember-Salt from the Bastion of Fireblood can substitute for phosphorus.

allSpells.name: Wall of Force
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of powder made by crushing a clear gemstone)
allSpells.description: An invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose and can be a flat surface or hemispherical dome or sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet. Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by dispel magic. A disintegrate spell destroys the wall instantly.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Crushed Arterial Glass can substitute for the clear gemstone powder.

allSpells.name: Wall of Ice
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a small piece of quartz)
allSpells.description:
You create a wall of ice on a solid surface within range. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-square panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1 foot thick and lasts for the duration.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall and must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10d6 cold damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. It has AC 12 and 30 hit points per 10-foot section, and it is vulnerable to fire damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage the wall deals when it appears increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 6th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A piece of Bone Ridge Stone or White Marcher crystal can substitute for quartz.

allSpells.name: Wall of Light
allSpells.description: A shimmering wall of bright light appears at a point you choose within range. The wall can be up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. When the wall appears, each creature in its area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d8 radiant damage and is blinded for 1 minute.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

allSpells.name: Wall of Sand
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a handful of sand)
allSpells.description: You create a wall of swirling sand on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 10 feet thick, and it vanishes when the spell ends. It blocks line of sight but not movement. A creature is blinded while in the wall's space and must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves there.
allSpells.ashenRealms: A handful of volcanic ash can substitute for sand, creating a wall of swirling ash instead.

allSpells.name: Wall of Stone
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a small block of granite)
allSpells.description:
A nonmagical wall of solid stone springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall is 6 inches thick and is composed of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with at least one other panel. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall.

If you maintain your concentration on this spell for its whole duration, the wall becomes permanent and can't be dispelled. Otherwise, the wall disappears when the spell ends.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Bone Ridge Stone can substitute for granite.

allSpells.name: Wall of Thorns
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a handful of thorns)
allSpells.description:
You create a wall of tough, pliable, tangled brush bristling with needle-sharp thorns. The wall appears within range on a solid surface and lasts for the duration. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a circle that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7d8 piercing damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

A creature can move through the wall, albeit slowly and painfully. For every 1 foot a creature moves through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, the first time a creature enters the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 7d8 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, both types of damage increase by 1d8 for each slot level above 6th.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Thorns from the Blooming Rot's bramble-fungi can substitute.

allSpells.name: Wall of Water
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a drop of water)
allSpells.description:
You create a wall of water on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or you can make a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall vanishes when the spell ends. The wall's space is difficult terrain.

Any ranged weapon attack that enters the wall's space has disadvantage on the attack roll, and fire damage is halved if the fire effect passes through the wall to reach its target. Spells that deal cold damage that pass through the wall cause the area of the wall they pass through to freeze solid (at least a 5-foot-square section is frozen). Each 5-foot-square frozen section has AC 5 and 15 hit points. Reducing a frozen section to 0 hit points destroys it. When a section is destroyed, the wall's water doesn't fill it.

allSpells.name: Warding Bond
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a pair of platinum rings worth at least 50 gp each, which you and the target must wear for the duration)
allSpells.description:
This spell wards a willing creature you touch and creates a mystic connection between you and the target until the spell ends. While the target is within 60 feet of you, it gains a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws, and it has resistance to all damage. Also, each time it takes damage, you take the same amount of damage.

The spell ends if you drop to 0 hit points or if you and the target become separated by more than 60 feet. It also ends if the spell is cast again on either of the connected creatures. You can also dismiss the spell as an action.

allSpells.name: Warding Glance
allSpells.castingTime: 1 reaction (when a creature you can see within 30 feet targets you with a divination spell)
allSpells.description:
You instinctively deflect divine sight. When targeted by a divination spell, you can impose disadvantage on any attack roll or ability check associated with that spell. If the spell requires a saving throw from you, you have advantage on it.

This cantrip was developed in the Free Cities specifically to resist Sovereign surveillance.

allSpells.name: Warding Wind
allSpells.description:
A strong wind (20 miles per hour) blows around you in a 10-foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you. The wind lasts for the spell's duration.

The wind has the following effects:

- It deafens you and other creatures in its area.

- It extinguishes unprotected flames in its area that are torch-sized or smaller.

- It hedges out vapor, gas, and fog that can be dispersed by strong wind.

- The area is difficult terrain for creatures other than you.

- The attack rolls of ranged weapon attacks have disadvantage if the attacks pass in or out of the wind.

allSpells.name: Water Breathing
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a short reed or piece of straw)
allSpells.description: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures you can see within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

allSpells.name: Water Walk
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a piece of cork)
allSpells.description:
This spell grants the ability to move across any liquid surface — such as water, acid, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava — as if it were harmless solid ground (creatures crossing molten lava can still take damage from the heat). Up to ten willing creatures you can see within range gain this ability for the duration.

If you target a creature submerged in a liquid, the spell carries the target to the surface of the liquid at a rate of 60 feet per round.

allSpells.name: Watery Sphere
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a droplet of water)
allSpells.description:
You conjure up a sphere of water with a 5-foot radius on a point you can see within range. The sphere can hover in the air, but no more than 10 feet off the ground. The sphere remains for the spell's duration.

Any creature in the sphere's space must make a Strength saving throw. On a successful save, a creature is ejected from that space to the nearest unoccupied space outside it. A Huge or larger creature succeeds on the saving throw automatically. On a failed save, a creature is restrained by the sphere and is engulfed by the water. At the end of each of its turns, a restrained target can repeat the saving throw.

The sphere can restrain a maximum of four Medium or smaller creatures or one Large creature. If the sphere restrains a creature in excess of these numbers, a random creature that was already restrained by the sphere falls out of it and lands prone in a space within 5 feet of it.

As an action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet in a straight line. If it moves over a pit, cliff, or other drop, it safely descends until it is hovering 10 feet over ground. Any creature restrained by the sphere moves with it. You can ram the sphere into creatures, forcing them to make the saving throw, but no more than once per turn.

When the spell ends, the sphere falls to the ground and extinguishes all normal flames within 30 feet of it. Any creature restrained by the sphere is knocked prone in the space where it falls.

allSpells.name: Weaponized Secret
allSpells.components: V, S, M (proof of a secret the target wants hidden)
allSpells.description:
You speak a secret about the target - something true that they desperately want hidden. You must actually know this secret (you can't make something up). The target and all creatures within 30 feet who can hear you learn the secret.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw:

- **On failure:** 10d10 psychic damage, and they are stunned for 1 minute as shame overwhelms them. They have disadvantage on all Charisma checks against anyone who heard the secret for 1 year.

- **On success:** Half damage, no stun.

**Special:** If the secret would cause the target's allies to turn on them (GM discretion), those allies must make Wisdom saves or become hostile to the target for 1 minute.

**Sovereign Attention:** Ismara treasures secrets. Using one as a weapon is both tribute and sacrifice to her.

allSpells.name: Web
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a bit of spiderweb)
allSpells.description:
You conjure a mass of thick, sticky webbing at a point of your choice within range. The webs fill a 20-foot cube from that point for the duration. The webs are difficult terrain and lightly obscure their area.

If the webs are not anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the conjured web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

Each creature that starts its turn in the webs or that enters them during its turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is restrained as long as it remains in the webs or until it breaks free.

A creature restrained by the webs can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer restrained.

The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing 2d4 fire damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.
allSpells.ashenRealms: The spiderweb can be replaced with strands of Silken Rot-Moss or web from an Ash-Spider.

allSpells.name: Weird
allSpells.description:
Drawing on the deepest fears of a group of creatures, you create illusory creatures in their minds, visible only to them. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes frightened for the duration. The illusion calls on the creature's deepest fears, manifesting its worst nightmares as an implacable threat.

At the end of each of the frightened creature's turns, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 4d10 psychic damage. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.
allSpells.ashenRealms: This spell often manifests fears of the Thirteen Sovereigns—the Hollow Crown's void, the Crimson Matron's hunger, the Verdant King's consuming growth.

allSpells.name: Whirlwind
allSpells.description:
A whirlwind howls down to a point that you can see on the ground within range. The whirlwind is a 10-foot-radius, 30-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Until the spell ends, you can use your action to move the whirlwind up to 30 feet in any direction along the ground. The whirlwind sucks up any Medium or smaller objects that aren't secured to anything and that aren't worn or carried by anyone.

A creature must make a Dexterity saving throw the first time on a turn that it enters the whirlwind or that the whirlwind enters its space, including when the whirlwind first appears. A creature takes 10d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a Large or smaller creature that fails the save must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become restrained in the whirlwind until the spell ends.

When a creature starts its turn restrained by the whirlwind, the creature is pulled 5 feet higher inside it, unless the creature is at the top. A restrained creature moves with the whirlwind and falls when the spell ends, unless the creature has some means to stay aloft.

A restrained creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check against your spell save DC. If successful, the creature is no longer restrained by the whirlwind and is hurled 3d6 × 10 feet away from it in a random direction.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Near the Blooming Rot, whirlwinds conjured by this spell carry spores and fungal debris.

allSpells.name: Wind Walk
allSpells.components: V, S, M (fire and holy water)
allSpells.description: You and up to ten willing creatures you can see within range assume a gaseous form for the duration, appearing as wisps of cloud. While in this cloud form, a creature has a flying speed of 300 feet and has resistance to damage from nonmagical weapons. The only actions a creature can take in this form are the Dash action or to revert to its normal form. Reverting takes 1 minute, during which time a creature is incapacitated and can't move. Until the spell ends, a creature can revert to cloud form, which also requires the 1-minute transformation.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Ember-Salt and Sanctified Blood can substitute for fire and holy water.

allSpells.name: Wind Wall
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a tiny fan and a feather of exotic origin)
allSpells.description:
A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and automatically miss. (Boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.) Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

allSpells.name: Wish
allSpells.description:
Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal creature can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter the very foundations of reality in accord with your desires.

The basic use of this spell is to duplicate any other spell of 8th level or lower. You don't need to meet any requirements in that spell, including costly components. The spell simply takes effect.

Alternatively, you can create one of the following effects of your choice:

- Create one object of up to 25,000 gp in value that isn't a magic item.

- Allow up to twenty creatures that you can see to regain all hit points, and end all effects described in the greater restoration spell.

- Grant up to ten creatures resistance to a damage type you choose.

- Grant up to ten creatures immunity to a single spell or magical effect for 8 hours.

- Undo a single recent event by forcing a reroll of any roll made within the last round.

The stress of casting this spell to produce any effect other than duplicating another spell weakens you. After enduring that stress, each time you cast a spell until you finish a long rest, you take 1d10 necrotic damage per level of that spell. Your Strength drops to 3 for 2d4 days. Finally, there is a 33 percent chance that you are unable to cast wish ever again.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, wish is rumored to draw upon the power of Aedwynn the Maker, whose creative essence still suffuses reality.

allSpells.name: Witch Bolt
allSpells.components: V, S, M (a twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning)
allSpells.description: A beam of crackling, blue energy lances out toward a creature within range, forming a sustained arc of lightning between you and the target. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 lightning damage, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to deal 1d12 lightning damage to the target automatically. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else. The spell also ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.
allSpells.higherLevels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 1st.
allSpells.ashenRealms: Use a shard of Cindermaw chitin that has been exposed to lightning.

allSpells.name: Word of Radiance
allSpells.description: You utter a divine word, and burning radiance erupts from you. Each creature of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 radiant damage.
allSpells.higherLevels: The spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

allSpells.name: Word of Recall
allSpells.description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary. If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location, such as a temple, dedicated to or strongly linked to your deity. If you attempt to cast the spell in this manner in an area that isn't dedicated to your deity, the spell has no effect.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, sanctuaries are typically locations dedicated to one of the Thirteen Sovereigns.

allSpells.name: Wrath of Nature
allSpells.description:
You call out to the spirits of nature to rouse them against your enemies. Choose a point you can see within range. The spirits cause trees, rocks, and grasses in a 60-foot cube centered on that point to become animated until the spell ends.

**Grasses and Undergrowth.** Any area of ground in the cube that is covered by grass or undergrowth is difficult terrain for your enemies.

**Trees.** At the start of each of your turns, each of your enemies within 10 feet of any tree in the cube must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 4d6 slashing damage.

**Rocks.** As a bonus action on your turn, you can cause a loose rock in the cube to launch at a creature you can see. On a hit, the target takes 3d8 bludgeoning damage.
allSpells.ashenRealms: In the Ashen Realms, this spell animates the fungal growths, bone formations, and petrified vegetation native to each domain.

allSpells.name: Wrathful Smite
allSpells.description: The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your attack deals an extra 1d6 psychic damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the spell ends. As an action, the creature can make a Wisdom check against your spell save DC to steel its resolve and end this spell.

allSpells.name: Zephyr Strike
allSpells.description:
You move like the wind. Until the spell ends, your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

Once before the spell ends, you can give yourself advantage on one weapon attack roll on your turn. That attack deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit. Whether you hit or miss, your walking speed increases by 30 feet until the end of that turn.

allSpells.name: Zone of Truth
allSpells.description:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature cannot speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.
